  THERSITES. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. That same Diomed's a false-hearted rogue, a most unjust
  THERSITES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. That same Diomed's a false-hearted rogue, a most unjust
    knave; I will no more trust him when he leers than I will a
    serpent when he hisses. He will spend his mouth and promise, like
    Brabbler the hound; but when he performs, astronomers foretell
    it: it is prodigious, there will come some change; the sun
    borrows of the moon when Diomed keeps his word. I will rather
    leave to see Hector than not to dog him. They say he keeps a
    Troyan drab, and uses the traitor Calchas' tent. I'll after.
    Nothing but lechery! All incontinent varlets!                Exit
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. What, are you up here, ho? Speak.
  CALCHAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
LCHAS. [Within] Who calls?
  DIOMEDES.

AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Diomed. Calchas, I think. Where's your daughter?
  CALCHAS.

  DIOMEDES.

  CRESSIDA.

CASSANDRA

  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM

HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. A juggling trick, to be secretly open.
  DIOMEDES. 
12

ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. What did you swear you would bestow on me?
  CRESSIDA.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I prithee, do not hold me to mine oath;
  DIOMEDES.

CASSANDRA

  DIOMEDES.

AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. And so, good night.
  CRESSIDA.

PRIAM

HECTOR
AJAX

ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Nay, but you part in anger.
  TROILUS. 
12

HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Doth that grieve thee? O withered truth!
  ULYSSES.

HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. In faith, I do not. Come hither once again.
  ULYSSES.

CASSANDRA

  THERSITES.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. How the devil luxury, with his fat rump and potato
  DIOMEDES.

CRESSIDA

  ULYSSES.

CASSANDRA

  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Fear me not, my lord;
    I will not be myself, nor have cognition
    Of what I feel. I am all patience.
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS

AJAX

  CRESSIDA.

  CRESSIDA.

CASSANDRA

  DIOMEDES.

  DIOMEDES.

OMEDES. What, shall I come? The hour-
  CRESSIDA.

AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Ay, come-O Jove! Do come. I shall be plagu'd.
  DIOMEDES.

PARIS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  THERSITES.

  ULYSSES.

  ULYSSES.

AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  TROILUS. 
11

PARIS

PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Why, my negation hath no taste of madness.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Nor mine, my lord. Cressid was here but now.
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Let it not be believ'd for womanhood.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. What hath she done, Prince, that can soil our mothers?
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Nothing at all, unless that this were she.
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Will 'a swagger himself out on's own eyes?
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. This she? No; this is Diomed's Cressida.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. May worthy Troilus be half-attach'd
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Ay, Greek; and that shall be divulged well
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. He'll tickle it for his concupy.
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. O Cressid! O false Cressid! false, false, false!
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O, contain yourself;
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O, contain yourself;
    Your passion draws ears hither.
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. I have been seeking you this hour, my lord.
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Have with you, Prince. My courteous lord, adieu.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. I'll bring you to the gates.
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Accept distracted thanks.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Accept distracted thanks.
            Exeunt TROILUS, AENEAS. and ULYSSES
  THERSITES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Would I could meet that rogue Diomed! I would croak like
  THERSITES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Would I could meet that rogue Diomed! I would croak like
    a raven; I would bode, I would bode. Patroclus will give me
    anything for the intelligence of this whore; the parrot will not
    do more for an almond than he for a commodious drab. Lechery,
    lechery! Still wars and lechery! Nothing else holds fashion. A
    burning devil take them!                                     Exit
  ANDROMACHE. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS

HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
DROMACHE. When was my lord so much ungently temper'd
  HECTOR.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. You train me to offend you; get you in.
  ANDROMACHE.

  HECTOR.

TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Hold you still, I say.
    Mine honour keeps the weather of my fate.
    Life every man holds dear; but the dear man
    Holds honour far more precious dear than life.
  ANDROMACHE. 
11
AENEAS

  HECTOR.

10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Who should withhold me?
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Who should withhold me?
    Not fate, obedience, nor the hand of Mars
    Beck'ning with fiery truncheon my retire;
    Not Priamus and Hecuba on knees,
    Their eyes o'ergalled with recourse of tears;
    Nor you, my brother, with your true sword drawn,
    Oppos'd to hinder me, should stop my way,
    But by my ruin.
  CASSANDRA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. Lay hold upon him, Priam, hold him fast;
  PRIAM. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES

OILUS. They are at it, hark! Proud Diomed, believe,
    I come to lose my arm or win my sleeve.
  PANDARUS.

  TROILUS.

AENEAS
ULYSSES

CASSANDRA
OILUS. Words, words, mere words, no matter from the heart;
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Words, words, mere words, no matter from the heart;
    Th' effect doth operate another way.
                                                 [Tearing the letter]
    Go, wind, to wind, there turn and change together.
    My love with words and errors still she feeds,
    But edifies another with her deeds.              Exeunt severally
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Now they are clapper-clawing one another; I'll go look
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Now they are clapper-clawing one another; I'll go look
    on. That dissembling abominable varlet, Diomed, has got that same
    scurvy doting foolish young knave's sleeve of Troy there in his
    helm. I would fain see them meet, that that same young Troyan ass
    that loves the whore there might send that Greekish whoremasterly
    villain with the sleeve back to the dissembling luxurious drab of
    a sleeve-less errand. A th' t'other side, the policy of those
    crafty swearing rascals-that stale old mouse-eaten dry cheese,
    Nestor, and that same dog-fox, Ulysses -is not prov'd worth a
    blackberry. They set me up, in policy, that mongrel cur, Ajax,
    against that dog of as bad a kind, Achilles; and now is the cur,
    Ajax prouder than the cur Achilles, and will not arm to-day;
    whereupon the Grecians begin to proclaim barbarism, and policy
    grows into an ill opinion.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Fly not; for shouldst thou take the river Styx
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Thou dost miscall retire.
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Hold thy whore, Grecian; now for thy whore,
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Hold thy whore, Grecian; now for thy whore,
    Troyan-now the sleeve, now the sleeve!
                                 Exeunt TROILUS and DIOMEDES fighting
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. What art thou, Greek? Art thou for Hector's match?
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. No, no-I am a rascal; a scurvy railing knave; a very
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I do believe thee. Live.                               Exit
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. God-a-mercy, that thou wilt believe me; but a plague
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. God-a-mercy, that thou wilt believe me; but a plague
    break thy neck for frighting me! What's become of the wenching
    rogues? I think they have swallowed one another. I would laugh at
    that miracle. Yet, in a sort, lechery eats itself. I'll seek
    them.                                                        Exit
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Go, go, my servant, take thou Troilus' horse;
  SERVANT. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RVANT. I go, my lord.                                        Exit
  AGAMEMNON. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Renew, renew! The fierce Polydamus
  AGAMEMNON. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Renew, renew! The fierce Polydamus
    Hath beat down enon; bastard Margarelon
    Hath Doreus prisoner,
    And stands colossus-wise, waving his beam,
    Upon the pashed corses of the kings
    Epistrophus and Cedius. Polixenes is slain;
    Amphimacus and Thoas deadly hurt;
    Patroclus ta'en, or slain; and Palamedes
    Sore hurt and bruis'd. The dreadful Sagittary
    Appals our numbers. Haste we, Diomed,
    To reinforcement, or we perish all.
  NESTOR. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Go, bear Patroclus' body to Achilles,
  NESTOR. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Go, bear Patroclus' body to Achilles,
    And bid the snail-pac'd Ajax arm for shame.
    There is a thousand Hectors in the field;
    Now here he fights on Galathe his horse,
    And there lacks work; anon he's there afoot,
    And there they fly or die, like scaled sculls
    Before the belching whale; then is he yonder,
    And there the strawy Greeks, ripe for his edge,
    Fall down before him like the mower's swath.
    Here, there, and everywhere, he leaves and takes;
    Dexterity so obeying appetite
    That what he will he does, and does so much
    That proof is call'd impossibility.
  ULYSSES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O, courage, courage, courage, Princes! Great
  ULYSSES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O, courage, courage, courage, Princes! Great
    Achilles Is arming, weeping, cursing, vowing vengeance.
    Patroclus' wounds have rous'd his drowsy blood,
    Together with his mangled Myrmidons,
    That noseless, handless, hack'd and chipp'd, come to
    him, Crying on Hector. Ajax hath lost a friend
    And foams at mouth, and he is arm'd and at it,
    Roaring for Troilus; who hath done to-day
    Mad and fantastic execution,
    Engaging and redeeming of himself
    With such a careless force and forceless care
    As if that luck, in very spite of cunning,
    Bade him win all.
  AJAX. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Troilus! thou coward Troilus!                            Exit
  DIOMEDES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Ay, there, there.
  NESTOR. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. So, so, we draw together.                              Exit
  ACHILLES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Where is this Hector?
  ACHILLES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Where is this Hector?
    Come, come, thou boy-queller, show thy face;
    Know what it is to meet Achilles angry.
    Hector! where's Hector? I will none but Hector.            Exeunt
  AJAX. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Troilus, thou coward Troilus, show thy head.
  DIOMEDES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Troilus, I say! Where's Troilus?
  AJAX.

CTOR. Stand, stand, thou Greek; thou art a goodly mark.
    No? wilt thou not? I like thy armour well;
    I'll frush it and unlock the rivets all
    But I'll be master of it. Wilt thou not, beast, abide?
    Why then, fly on; I'll hunt thee for thy hide.             Exeunt
  ACHILLES.

  ACHILLES.

AENEAS

AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Come here about me, you my Myrmidons;
    Mark what I say. Attend me where I wheel;
    Strike not a stroke, but keep yourselves in breath;
    And when I have the bloody Hector found,
    Empale him with your weapons round about;
    In fellest manner execute your arms.
    Follow me, sirs, and my proceedings eye.
    It is decreed Hector the great must die.                   Exeunt
  THERSITES.

HILLES. The dragon wing of night o'erspreads the earth
    And, stickler-like, the armies separates.
    My half-supp'd sword, that frankly would have fed,
    Pleas'd with this dainty bait, thus goes to bed.
                                                 [Sheathes his sword]
    Come, tie his body to my horse's tail;
    Along the field I will the Troyan trail.                   Exeunt
  AGAMEMNON.

    To pray Achilles see us at our tent.
    If in his death the gods have us befriended;
    Great Troy is ours, and our sharp wars are ended.
    Exeunt
  AENEAS.

MARGARELON

CASSANDRA
OILUS. You understand me not that tell me so.
  TROILUS. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. You understand me not that tell me so.
    I do not speak of flight, of fear of death,
    But dare all imminence that gods and men
    Address their dangers in. Hector is gone.
    Who shall tell Priam so, or Hecuba?
    Let him that will a screech-owl aye be call'd
    Go in to Troy, and say there 'Hector's dead.'
    There is a word will Priam turn to stone;
    Make wells and Niobes of the maids and wives,
    Cold statues of the youth; and, in a word,
    Scare Troy out of itself. But, march away;
    Hector is dead; there is no more to say.
    Stay yet. You vile abominable tents,
    Thus proudly pight upon our Phrygian plains,
    Let Titan rise as early as he dare,
    I'll through and through you. And, thou great-siz'd coward,
    No space of earth shall sunder our two hates;
    I'll haunt thee like a wicked conscience still,
    That mouldeth goblins swift as frenzy's thoughts.
    Strike a free march to Troy. With comfort go;
    Hope of revenge shall hide our inward woe.
  PANDARUS. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. But hear you, hear you!
  TROILUS.

  CRESSIDA, 
1
TROILUS
ESSIDA, daughter to Calchas
                          SCENE:
             Troy and the Greek camp before it
                  TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
                        PROLOGUE
    In Troy, there lies the scene. From isles of Greece
    The princes orgillous, their high blood chaf'd,
    Have to the port of Athens sent their ships
    Fraught with the ministers and instruments
    Of cruel war. Sixty and nine that wore
    Their crownets regal from th' Athenian bay
    Put forth toward Phrygia; and their vow is made
    To ransack Troy, within whose strong immures
    The ravish'd Helen, Menelaus' queen,
    With wanton Paris sleeps-and that's the quarrel.
    To Tenedos they come,
    And the deep-drawing barks do there disgorge
    Their war-like fraughtage. Now on Dardan plains
    The fresh and yet unbruised Greeks do pitch
    Their brave pavilions: Priam's six-gated city,
    Dardan, and Tymbria, Helias, Chetas, Troien,
    And Antenorides, with massy staples
    And corresponsive and fulfilling bolts,
    Sperr up the sons of Troy.
    Now expectation, tickling skittish spirits
    On one and other side, Troyan and Greek,
    Sets all on hazard-and hither am I come
    A Prologue arm'd, but not in confidence
    Of author's pen or actor's voice, but suited
    In like conditions as our argument,
    To tell you, fair beholders, that our play
    Leaps o'er the vaunt and firstlings of those broils,
    Beginning in the middle; starting thence away,
    To what may be digested in a play.
    Like or find fault; do as your pleasures are;
    Now good or bad, 'tis but the chance of war.
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. Call here my varlet; I'll unarm again.
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. Will this gear ne'er be mended?
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. The Greeks are strong, and skilful to their strength,
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. Well, I have told you enough of this; for my part,
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. Have I not tarried?
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. Ay, the grinding; but you must tarry the bolting.
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. Have I not tarried?
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. Ay, the bolting; but you must tarry the leavening.
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. Still have I tarried.
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. Ay, to the leavening; but here's yet in the word
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. Patience herself, what goddess e'er she be,
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. Well, she look'd yesternight fairer than ever I saw her
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. I was about to tell thee: when my heart,
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. An her hair were not somewhat darker than Helen's- well,
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. O Pandarus! I tell thee, Pandarus-
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. I speak no more than truth.
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. Thou dost not speak so much.
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. Faith, I'll not meddle in it. Let her be as she is: if
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. Good Pandarus! How now, Pandarus!
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. I have had my labour for my travail, ill thought on of
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. What, art thou angry, Pandarus? What, with me?
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. Because she's kin to me, therefore she's not so fair as
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. Say I she is not fair?
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. I do not care whether you do or no. She's a fool to stay
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. Pandarus!
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. Not I.
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. Sweet Pandarus!
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. Pray you, speak no more to me: I will leave all
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. Peace, you ungracious clamours! Peace, rude sounds!
  TROILUS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
OILUS. Peace, you ungracious clamours! Peace, rude sounds!
    Fools on both sides! Helen must needs be fair,
    When with your blood you daily paint her thus.
    I cannot fight upon this argument;
    It is too starv'd a subject for my sword.
    But Pandarus-O gods, how do you plague me!
    I cannot come to Cressid but by Pandar;
    And he's as tetchy to be woo'd to woo
    As she is stubborn-chaste against all suit.
    Tell me, Apollo, for thy Daphne's love,
    What Cressid is, what Pandar, and what we?
    Her bed is India; there she lies, a pearl;
    Between our Ilium and where she resides
    Let it be call'd the wild and wand'ring flood;
    Ourself the merchant, and this sailing Pandar
    Our doubtful hope, our convoy, and our bark.
  AENEAS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
NEAS. How now, Prince Troilus! Wherefore not afield?
  TROILUS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
OILUS. Because not there. This woman's answer sorts,
  AENEAS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
NEAS. That Paris is returned home, and hurt.
  TROILUS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
OILUS. By whom, Aeneas?
  AENEAS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
NEAS. Troilus, by Menelaus.
  TROILUS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
OILUS. Let Paris bleed: 'tis but a scar to scorn;
  AENEAS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
NEAS. Hark what good sport is out of town to-day!
  TROILUS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
OILUS. Better at home, if 'would I might' were 'may.'
  AENEAS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
NEAS. In all swift haste.
  TROILUS. 
3
TROILUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Come, go we then together.                          Exeunt
  CRESSIDA. 
3
TROILUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Who were those went by?
  ALEXANDER. 
3
TROILUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
EXANDER. Queen Hecuba and Helen.
  CRESSIDA. 
3
TROILUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. And whither go they?

3

CRESSIDA

  CRESSIDA.

CRESSIDA

  CRESSIDA.

TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
EXANDER. They say he yesterday cop'd Hector in the battle and
    struck him down, the disdain and shame whereof hath ever since
    kept Hector fasting and waking.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Who comes here?
  ALEXANDER. 
4

  ALEXANDER.

CRESSIDA
EXANDER. As may be in the world, lady.

  PANDARUS.

  CRESSIDA.

PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA

  PANDARUS. 
4

PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA

  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA

  PANDARUS. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. Himself! Alas, poor Troilus! I would he were!
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. So he is.
  PANDARUS. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. Condition I had gone barefoot to India.
  CRESSIDA. 
4

ESSIDA. He is not Hector.
  PANDARUS.

AENEAS
CRESSIDA

  CRESSIDA.

CRESSIDA

3
TROILUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. By the same token, you are a bawd.
                                                        Exit PANDARUS
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. By the same token, you are a bawd.
                                                        Exit PANDARUS
    Words, vows, gifts, tears, and love's full sacrifice,
    He offers in another's enterprise;
    But more in Troilus thousand-fold I see
    Than in the glass of Pandar's praise may be,
    Yet hold I off. Women are angels, wooing:
    Things won are done; joy's soul lies in the doing.
    That she belov'd knows nought that knows not this:
    Men prize the thing ungain'd more than it is.
    That she was never yet that ever knew
    Love got so sweet as when desire did sue;
    Therefore this maxim out of love I teach:
    Achievement is command; ungain'd, beseech.
    Then though my heart's content firm love doth bear,
    Nothing of that shall from mine eyes appear.                 Exit
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
AMEMNON. Princes,
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. With due observance of thy godlike seat,
  ULYSSES. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. Agamemnon,
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
AMEMNON. Speak, Prince of Ithaca; and be't of less expect
  ULYSSES. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. Troy, yet upon his basis, had been down,
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. Most wisely hath Ulysses here discover'd
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
AMEMNON. The nature of the sickness found, Ulysses,
  ULYSSES. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. The great Achilles, whom opinion crowns
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

  ULYSSES. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. They tax our policy and call it cowardice,
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

  MENELAUS. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
NELAUS. From Troy.
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
AMEMNON. What would you fore our tent?
  AENEAS. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
NEAS. Is this great Agamemnon's tent, I pray you?
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
AMEMNON. Even this.
  AENEAS. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

  AENEAS. 
4

AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

  AGAMEMNON. 
4

AENEAS
AGAMEMNON

  AENEAS.

TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

  AGAMEMNON. 
4

AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

  AENEAS. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
NEAS. Courtiers as free, as debonair, unarm'd,
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
AMEMNON. Sir, you of Troy, call you yourself Aeneas?
  AENEAS. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
NEAS. Ay, Greek, that is my name.
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
AMEMNON. What's your affair, I pray you?
  AENEAS. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
NEAS. Sir, pardon; 'tis for Agamemnon's ears.
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
AMEMNON. He hears nought privately that comes from Troy.
  AENEAS. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
NEAS. Nor I from Troy come not to whisper with him;
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
AMEMNON. Speak frankly as the wind;
  AENEAS. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
NEAS. Trumpet, blow loud,
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
AMEMNON. This shall be told our lovers, Lord Aeneas.
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. Tell him of Nestor, one that was a man
  AENEAS. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
NEAS. Now heavens forfend such scarcity of youth!
  ULYSSES. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. Amen.
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
AMEMNON. Fair Lord Aeneas, let me touch your hand;
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
AMEMNON. Fair Lord Aeneas, let me touch your hand;
    To our pavilion shall I lead you, first.
    Achilles shall have word of this intent;
    So shall each lord of Greece, from tent to tent.
    Yourself shall feast with us before you go,
    And find the welcome of a noble foe.
                                    Exeunt all but ULYSSES and NESTOR
  ULYSSES. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. Nestor!
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. What says Ulysses?
  ULYSSES. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. I have a young conception in my brain;
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. What is't?
  ULYSSES. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. This 'tis:
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. Well, and how?
  ULYSSES. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. This challenge that the gallant Hector sends,
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. True. The purpose is perspicuous even as substance
  ULYSSES. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. And wake him to the answer, think you?
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. Why, 'tis most meet. Who may you else oppose
  ULYSSES. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. Give pardon to my speech.
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. I see them not with my old eyes. What are they?
  ULYSSES. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. What glory our Achilles shares from Hector,
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. Now, Ulysses, I begin to relish thy advice;
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. Now, Ulysses, I begin to relish thy advice;
    And I will give a taste thereof forthwith
    To Agamemnon. Go we to him straight.
    Two curs shall tame each other: pride alone
    Must tarre the mastiffs on, as 'twere their bone.          Exeunt
  AJAX. 
4
TROILUS

AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
AX. Thersites!
  THERSITES.

CRESSIDA

  AJAX.

CRESSIDA

  THERSITES.

CRESSIDA

  AJAX.

CRESSIDA

  THERSITES.

AGAMEMNON

  AJAX.

AGAMEMNON

  THERSITES.

AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I am yours,
    You valiant offspring of great Priamus.
    I have a roisting challenge sent amongst
    The dull and factious nobles of the Greeks
    Will strike amazement to their drowsy spirits.
    I was advertis'd their great general slept,
    Whilst emulation in the army crept.
    This, I presume, will wake him.                            Exeunt
  THERSITES. 
8
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PRIAM
ACHILLES

THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. How now, Thersites! What, lost in the labyrinth of thy
  THERSITES. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. How now, Thersites! What, lost in the labyrinth of thy
    fury? Shall the elephant Ajax carry it thus? He beats me, and I
    rail at him. O worthy satisfaction! Would it were otherwise: that
    I could beat him, whilst he rail'd at me! 'Sfoot, I'll learn to
    conjure and raise devils, but I'll see some issue of my spiteful
    execrations. Then there's Achilles, a rare engineer! If Troy be
    not taken till these two undermine it, the walls will stand till
    they fall of themselves. O thou great thunder-darter of Olympus,
    forget that thou art Jove, the king of gods, and, Mercury, lose
    all the serpentine craft of thy caduceus, if ye take not that
    little little less-than-little wit from them that they have!
    which short-arm'd ignorance itself knows is so abundant scarce,
    it will not in circumvention deliver a fly from a spider without
    drawing their massy irons and cutting the web. After this, the
    vengeance on the whole camp! or, rather, the Neapolitan
    bone-ache! for that, methinks, is the curse depending on those
    that war for a placket. I have said my prayers; and devil Envy
    say 'Amen.' What ho! my Lord Achilles!
  PATROCLUS. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. Who's there? Thersites! Good Thersites, come in and
  THERSITES.

ERSITES. Here is such patchery, such juggling, and such knavery.
  THERSITES. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Here is such patchery, such juggling, and such knavery.
    All the argument is a whore and a cuckold-a good quarrel to draw
    emulous factions and bleed to death upon. Now the dry serpigo on
    the subject, and war and lechery confound all!               Exit
  AGAMEMNON. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON

  AGAMEMNON.

PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Your mind is the clearer, Ajax, and your virtues the
    fairer. He that is proud eats up himself. Pride is his own glass,
    his own trumpet, his own chronicle; and whatever praises itself
    but in the deed devours the deed in the praise.
  AJAX. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

OMEDES. Be rul'd by him, Lord Ajax.
  ULYSSES.

  AGAMEMNON.

AMEMNON. Go we to council. Let Achilles sleep.
    Light boats sail swift, though greater hulks draw deep.
    Exeunt
  PANDARUS.

12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Have you seen my cousin?
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. No, Pandarus. I stalk about her door
  PANDARUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Walk here i' th' orchard, I'll bring her straight.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. I am giddy; expectation whirls me round.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. I am giddy; expectation whirls me round.
    Th' imaginary relish is so sweet
    That it enchants my sense; what will it be
    When that the wat'ry palate tastes indeed
    Love's thrice-repured nectar? Death, I fear me;
    Swooning destruction; or some joy too fine,
    Too subtle-potent, tun'd too sharp in sweetness,
    For the capacity of my ruder powers.
    I fear it much; and I do fear besides
    That I shall lose distinction in my joys;
    As doth a battle, when they charge on heaps
    The enemy flying.
  PANDARUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. She's making her ready, she'll come straight; you must be
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Even such a passion doth embrace my bosom.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Even such a passion doth embrace my bosom.
    My heart beats thicker than a feverous pulse,
    And all my powers do their bestowing lose,
    Like vassalage at unawares encount'ring
    The eye of majesty.
  PANDARUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Come, come, what need you blush? Shame's a baby.-Here she
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. You have bereft me of all words, lady.
  PANDARUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Words pay no debts, give her deeds; but she'll bereave
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Will you walk in, my lord?
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. O Cressid, how often have I wish'd me thus!
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Wish'd, my lord! The gods grant-O my lord!
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. What should they grant? What makes this pretty abruption?
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. More dregs than water, if my fears have eyes.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Fears make devils of cherubims; they never see truly.
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Blind fear, that seeing reason leads, finds safer footing
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. O, let my lady apprehend no fear! In all Cupid's pageant
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Nor nothing monstrous neither?
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Nothing, but our undertakings when we vow to weep seas,
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. They say all lovers swear more performance than they are
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Are there such? Such are not we. Praise us as we are
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. What, blushing still? Have you not done talking yet?
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Well, uncle, what folly I commit, I dedicate to you.
  PANDARUS. 
12

AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS

PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES

CASSANDRA
NDARUS. I thank you for that; if my lord get a boy of you, you'll
  TROILUS.

PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. You know now your hostages: your uncle's word and my firm
  PANDARUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Nay, I'll give my word for her too: our kindred, though
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Boldness comes to me now and brings me heart.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Why was my Cressid then so hard to win?
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Hard to seem won; but I was won, my lord,
  TROILUS. 
12

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. And shall, albeit sweet music issues thence.
  PANDARUS.

NDARUS. Pretty, i' faith.
  CRESSIDA.

  TROILUS.

  CRESSIDA.

  TROILUS.

  TROILUS.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Amen. Whereupon I will show you a chamber
  PANDARUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Amen. Whereupon I will show you a chamber
    and a bed; which bed, because it shall not speak of your
    pretty encounters, press it to death. Away!
    And Cupid grant all tongue-tied maidens here,
    Bed, chamber, pander, to provide this gear!                Exeunt
  CALCHAS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
LCHAS. Now, Princes, for the service I have done,
  AGAMEMNON. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. What wouldst thou of us, Troyan? Make demand.
  CALCHAS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
LCHAS. You have a Troyan prisoner call'd Antenor,
  AGAMEMNON. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Let Diomedes bear him,
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. This shall I undertake; and 'tis a burden
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. This shall I undertake; and 'tis a burden
    Which I am proud to bear.
                                          Exeunt DIOMEDES and CALCHAS
  ULYSSES.

  ACHILLES.

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA

  NESTOR.

  ACHILLES.

  ACHILLES.

  PATROCLUS.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. They pass by strangely. They were us'd to bend,
  ACHILLES.

PARIS

PRIAM

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  ULYSSES.

  ACHILLES.

  ACHILLES.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. I do believe it; for they pass'd by me
  ULYSSES.

CASSANDRA

  ACHILLES.

CASSANDRA
HILLES. Of this my privacy
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. But 'gainst your privacy
  ACHILLES.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Go call Thersites hither, sweet Patroclus.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Go call Thersites hither, sweet Patroclus.
    I'll send the fool to Ajax, and desire him
    T' invite the Troyan lords, after the combat,
    To see us here unarm'd. I have a woman's longing,
    An appetite that I am sick withal,
    To see great Hector in his weeds of peace;
    To talk with him, and to behold his visage,
    Even to my full of view.
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. A wonder!
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. What?
  THERSITES.

PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  ACHILLES.

  ACHILLES.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

    And I myself see not the bottom of it.
                                        Exeunt ACHILLES and PATROCLUS
  THERSITES.

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. She's bitter to her country. Hear me, Paris:
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. Fair Diomed, you do as chapmen do,
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. Fair Diomed, you do as chapmen do,
    Dispraise the thing that you desire to buy;
    But we in silence hold this virtue well:
    We'll not commend what we intend to sell.
    Here lies our way.                                         Exeunt
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Dear, trouble not yourself; the morn is cold.
  CRESSIDA.

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  TROILUS.

CASSANDRA

CASSANDRA

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Go hang yourself, you naughty mocking uncle.
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  CRESSIDA. 
10

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Come, come, beshrew your heart! You'll ne'er be good,
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Ha, ha! Alas, poor wretch! a poor capocchia! hast not
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Did not I tell you? Would he were knock'd i' th' head!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Ha! ha!
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Come, you are deceiv'd, I think of no such thing.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Come, you are deceiv'd, I think of no such thing.
    How earnestly they knock! Pray you come in:
    I would not for half Troy have you seen here.
                                          Exeunt TROILUS and CRESSIDA
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Who's there? What's the matter? Will you beat down the
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Who's there? What's the matter? Will you beat down the
    door? How now? What's the matter?
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES

CASSANDRA

CASSANDRA

AENEAS

PARIS

THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  PANDARUS. 
9

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Come, he is here, my lord; do not deny him.
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Is he here, say you? It's more than I know, I'll be
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Who!-nay, then. Come, come, you'll do him wrong ere you are
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Who!-nay, then. Come, come, you'll do him wrong ere you are
    ware; you'll be so true to him to be false to him. Do not you
    know of him, but yet go fetch him hither; go.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. How now! What's the matter?
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. My lord, I scarce have leisure to salute you,
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Is it so concluded?
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. By Priam, and the general state of Troy.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. How my achievements mock me!
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Good, good, my lord, the secrets of neighbour Pandar
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Good, good, my lord, the secrets of neighbour Pandar
    Have not more gift in taciturnity.
                                            Exeunt TROILUS and AENEAS
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Is't possible? No sooner got but lost? The devil take
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Is't possible? No sooner got but lost? The devil take
    Antenor! The young prince will go mad. A plague upon Antenor! I
    would they had broke's neck.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. How now! What's the matter? Who was here?
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Ah, ah!
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why sigh you so profoundly? Where's my lord? Gone? Tell
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Would I were as deep under the earth as I am above!
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O the gods! What's the matter?
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Pray thee, get thee in. Would thou hadst ne'er been born!
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Good uncle, I beseech you, on my knees I beseech you,
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Thou must be gone, wench, thou must be gone; thou art
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O you immortal gods! I will not go.
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Thou must.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I will not, uncle. I have forgot my father;
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Do, do.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Tear my bright hair, and scratch my praised cheeks,
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Tear my bright hair, and scratch my praised cheeks,
    Crack my clear voice with sobs and break my heart,
    With sounding 'Troilus.' I will not go from Troy.
    Exeunt
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. It is great morning; and the hour prefix'd
  TROILUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Walk into her house.
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. I know what 'tis to love,
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. I know what 'tis to love,
    And would, as I shall pity, I could help!
    Please you walk in, my lords.                              Exeunt
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Be moderate, be moderate.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why tell you me of moderation?
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why tell you me of moderation?
    The grief is fine, full, perfect, that I taste,
    And violenteth in a sense as strong
    As that which causeth it. How can I moderate it?
    If I could temporize with my affections
    Or brew it to a weak and colder palate,
    The like allayment could I give my grief.
    My love admits no qualifying dross;
    No more my grief, in such a precious loss.
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Here, here, here he comes. Ah, sweet ducks!
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O Troilus! Troilus! [Embracing him]
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. What a pair of spectacles is here! Let me embrace too. 'O
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Cressid, I love thee in so strain'd a purity
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Have the gods envy?
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Ay, ay, ay; 'tis too plain a case.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. And is it true that I must go from Troy?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  CRESSIDA. 
10

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  TROILUS. 
10

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  CRESSIDA. 
10

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

PATROCLUS

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. And suddenly; where injury of chance
  AENEAS. 
10

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. [Within] My lord, is the lady ready?
  TROILUS. 
10

PATROCLUS
PARIS

CASSANDRA

  PANDARUS.

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Where are my tears? Rain, to lay this wind, or my heart
  CRESSIDA. 
10

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I must then to the Grecians?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. No remedy.
  CRESSIDA. 
10

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. A woeful Cressid 'mongst the merry Greeks!
  TROILUS. 
10

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  CRESSIDA. 
10

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I true! how now! What wicked deem is this?
  TROILUS. 
10

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O, you shall be expos'd, my lord, to dangers
  TROILUS. 
10

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  CRESSIDA. 
10

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS

10

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. I will corrupt the Grecian sentinels

10

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O heavens! 'Be true' again!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  CRESSIDA.

PATROCLUS
PARIS

PRIAM
TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

CASSANDRA

PATROCLUS
PARIS

  TROILUS.

PATROCLUS
PARIS

PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  AENEAS.

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

PATROCLUS
PARIS

PRIAM

OILUS. Come, kiss; and let us part.
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. [Within] Brother Troilus!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Good brother, come you hither;
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. My lord, will you be true?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Who, I? Alas, it is my vice, my fault!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Who, I? Alas, it is my vice, my fault!
    Whiles others fish with craft for great opinion,
    I with great truth catch mere simplicity;
    Whilst some with cunning gild their copper crowns,
    With truth and plainness I do wear mine bare.
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Fair Lady Cressid,
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Grecian, thou dost not use me courteously
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. O, be not mov'd, Prince Troilus.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Come, to the port. I'll tell thee, Diomed,
  TROILUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Come, to the port. I'll tell thee, Diomed,
    This brave shall oft make thee to hide thy head.
    Lady, give me your hand; and, as we walk,
    To our own selves bend we our needful talk.
                               Exeunt TROILUS, CRESSIDA, and DIOMEDES
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. Hark! Hector's trumpet.
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. How have we spent this morning!
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. 'Tis Troilus' fault. Come, come to field with him.
  DEIPHOBUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IPHOBUS. Let us make ready straight.
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Yea, with a bridegroom's fresh alacrity
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Yea, with a bridegroom's fresh alacrity
    Let us address to tend on Hector's heels.
    The glory of our Troy doth this day lie
    On his fair worth and single chivalry.                     Exeunt
  AGAMEMNON. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Here art thou in appointment fresh and fair,
  AJAX. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Thou, trumpet, there's my purse.
  ULYSSES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. No trumpet answers.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. 'Tis but early days.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  ULYSSES. 
11

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES

THERSITES

CASSANDRA

  AGAMEMNON. 
11

PARIS

THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  AGAMEMNON. 
11

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES

THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Most dearly welcome to the Greeks, sweet lady.
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Our general doth salute you with a kiss.
  ULYSSES. 
11

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX

  NESTOR.

CASSANDRA

  ACHILLES. 
11

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. I'll take that winter from your lips, fair lady.
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. I had good argument for kissing once.
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. But that's no argument for kissing now;
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O deadly gall, and theme of all our scorns!
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. The first was Menelaus' kiss; this, mine-
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. O, this is trim!
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. Paris and I kiss evermore for him.
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. I'll have my kiss, sir. Lady, by your leave.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. In kissing, do you render or receive?
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. Both take and give.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I'll make my match to live,
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. I'll give you boot; I'll give you three for one.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. You are an odd man; give even or give none.
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. An odd man, lady? Every man is odd.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. No, Paris is not; for you know 'tis true
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. You fillip me o' th' head.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. No, I'll be sworn.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. It were no match, your nail against his horn.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. You may.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. I do desire it.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why, beg then.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Why then, for Venus' sake give me a kiss
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I am your debtor; claim it when 'tis due.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Never's my day, and then a kiss of you.
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Lady, a word. I'll bring you to your father.
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Lady, a word. I'll bring you to your father.
                                                   Exit with CRESSIDA
  NESTOR. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
STOR. A woman of quick sense.
  ULYSSES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Fie, fie upon her!
  ALL. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
L. The Troyans' trumpet.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Yonder comes the troop.
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Hail, all the state of Greece! What shall be done
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Which way would Hector have it?
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. He cares not; he'll obey conditions.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. 'Tis done like Hector; but securely done,
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. If not Achilles, sir,
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. If not Achilles, nothing.
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Therefore Achilles. But whate'er, know this:
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. A maiden battle then? O, I perceive you!
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Here is Sir Diomed. Go, gentle knight,
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. They are oppos'd already.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. What Troyan is that same that looks so heavy?
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. The youngest son of Priam, a true knight;
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. They are in action.
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
STOR. Now, Ajax, hold thine own!
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hector, thou sleep'st;
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. His blows are well dispos'd. There, Ajax!
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. You must no more.
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Princes, enough, so please you.
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AX. I am not warm yet; let us fight again.
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. As Hector pleases.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Why, then will I no more.
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AX. I thank thee, Hector.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Not Neoptolemus so mirable,
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. There is expectance here from both the sides
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. We'll answer it:
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AX. If I might in entreaties find success,
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. 'Tis Agamemnon's wish; and great Achilles
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Aeneas, call my brother Troilus to me,
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AX. Great Agamemnon comes to meet us here.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. The worthiest of them tell me name by name;
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I thank thee, most imperious Agamemnon.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. [To Troilus] My well-fam'd lord of Troy, no less to you.
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. Let me confirm my princely brother's greeting.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Who must we answer?
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. The noble Menelaus.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. O you, my lord? By Mars his gauntlet, thanks!
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. Name her not now, sir; she's a deadly theme.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. O, pardon; I offend.
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
STOR. I have, thou gallant Troyan, seen thee oft,
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. 'Tis the old Nestor.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Let me embrace thee, good old chronicle,
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
STOR. I would my arms could match thee in contention
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I would they could.
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
STOR. Ha!
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. I wonder now how yonder city stands,
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I know your favour, Lord Ulysses, well.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Sir, I foretold you then what would ensue.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I must not believe you.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. So to him we leave it.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. I shall forestall thee, Lord Ulysses, thou!
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Is this Achilles?
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. I am Achilles.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Stand fair, I pray thee; let me look on thee.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Behold thy fill.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Nay, I have done already.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Thou art too brief. I will the second time,
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. O, like a book of sport thou'lt read me o'er;
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Tell me, you heavens, in which part of his body
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. It would discredit the blest gods, proud man,
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. I tell thee yea.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Wert thou an oracle to tell me so,
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AX. Do not chafe thee, cousin;
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I pray you let us see you in the field;
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Dost thou entreat me, Hector?
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Thy hand upon that match.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. First, all you peers of Greece, go to my tent;
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. First, all you peers of Greece, go to my tent;
    There in the full convive we; afterwards,
    As Hector's leisure and your bounties shall
    Concur together, severally entreat him.
    Beat loud the tambourines, let the trumpets blow,
    That this great soldier may his welcome know.
                                   Exeunt all but TROILUS and ULYSSES
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OILUS. My Lord Ulysses, tell me, I beseech you,
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. At Menelaus' tent, most princely Troilus.
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Shall I, sweet lord, be bound to you so much,
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. You shall command me, sir.
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OILUS. O, sir, to such as boasting show their scars
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OILUS. O, sir, to such as boasting show their scars
    A mock is due. Will you walk on, my lord?
    She was belov'd, she lov'd; she is, and doth;
    But still sweet love is food for fortune's tooth.          Exeunt
  ACHILLES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. I'll heat his blood with Greekish wine to-night,
  PATROCLUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. Here comes Thersites.
  ACHILLES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. How now, thou core of envy!
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS

PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Why, thou picture of what thou seemest, and idol of
  ACHILLES.

  PATROCLUS.

  PATROCLUS.

  PATROCLUS.

12

THERSITES

  ACHILLES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite
    From my great purpose in to-morrow's battle.
    Here is a letter from Queen Hecuba,
    A token from her daughter, my fair love,
    Both taxing me and gaging me to keep
    An oath that I have sworn. I will not break it.
    Fall Greeks; fail fame; honour or go or stay;
    My major vow lies here, this I'll obey.
    Come, come, Thersites, help to trim my tent;
    This night in banqueting must all be spent.
    Away, Patroclus!                              Exit with PATROCLUS
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. With too much blood and too little brain these two may
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. With too much blood and too little brain these two may
    run mad; but, if with too much brain and to little blood they do,
    I'll be a curer of madmen. Here's Agamemnon, an honest fellow
    enough, and one that loves quails, but he has not so much brain
    as ear-wax; and the goodly transformation of Jupiter there, his
    brother, the bull, the primitive statue and oblique memorial of
    cuckolds, a thrifty shoeing-horn in a chain, hanging at his
    brother's leg-to what form but that he is, should wit larded with
    malice, and malice forced with wit, turn him to? To an ass, were
    nothing: he is both ass and ox. To an ox, were nothing: he is both
    ox and ass. To be a dog, a mule, a cat, a fitchew, a toad, a
    lizard, an owl, a put-tock, or a herring without a roe, I would
    not care; but to be Menelaus, I would conspire against destiny.
    Ask me not what I would be, if I were not Thersites; for I care
    not to be the louse of a lazar, so I were not Menelaus. Hey-day!
    sprites and fires!
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. We go wrong, we go wrong.
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AX. No, yonder 'tis;
  HECTOR.

ULYSSES

THERSITES

  AJAX.

AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES

AX. No, not a whit.
  ULYSSES.

  THERSITES. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. That same Diomed's a false-hearted rogue, a most unjust
  THERSITES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. That same Diomed's a false-hearted rogue, a most unjust
    knave; I will no more trust him when he leers than I will a
    serpent when he hisses. He will spend his mouth and promise, like
    Brabbler the hound; but when he performs, astronomers foretell
    it: it is prodigious, there will come some change; the sun
    borrows of the moon when Diomed keeps his word. I will rather
    leave to see Hector than not to dog him. They say he keeps a
    Troyan drab, and uses the traitor Calchas' tent. I'll after.
    Nothing but lechery! All incontinent varlets!                Exit
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. What, are you up here, ho? Speak.
  CALCHAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
LCHAS. [Within] Who calls?
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Diomed. Calchas, I think. Where's your daughter?
  CALCHAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES

PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS

CASSANDRA

  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Guardian! Why, Greek!
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Fo, fo! adieu! you palter.
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. In faith, I do not. Come hither once again.
  ULYSSES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. You shake, my lord, at something; will you go?
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. She strokes his cheek.
  ULYSSES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Come, come.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Nay, stay; by Jove, I will not speak a word:
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. How the devil luxury, with his fat rump and potato
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. But will you, then?
  CRESSIDA.
