ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Who's there? My lord Aeneas? By my troth,
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Is not Prince Troilus here?
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Here! What should he do here?
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Come, he is here, my lord; do not deny him.
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Is he here, say you? It's more than I know, I'll be
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Who!-nay, then. Come, come, you'll do him wrong ere you are
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Who!-nay, then. Come, come, you'll do him wrong ere you are
    ware; you'll be so true to him to be false to him. Do not you
    know of him, but yet go fetch him hither; go.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. How now! What's the matter?
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. My lord, I scarce have leisure to salute you,
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Is it so concluded?
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. By Priam, and the general state of Troy.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. How my achievements mock me!
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Good, good, my lord, the secrets of neighbour Pandar
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Good, good, my lord, the secrets of neighbour Pandar
    Have not more gift in taciturnity.
                                            Exeunt TROILUS and AENEAS
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Is't possible? No sooner got but lost? The devil take
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Is't possible? No sooner got but lost? The devil take
    Antenor! The young prince will go mad. A plague upon Antenor! I
    would they had broke's neck.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. How now! What's the matter? Who was here?
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Ah, ah!
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why sigh you so profoundly? Where's my lord? Gone? Tell
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Would I were as deep under the earth as I am above!
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O the gods! What's the matter?
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Pray thee, get thee in. Would thou hadst ne'er been born!
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Good uncle, I beseech you, on my knees I beseech you,
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Thou must be gone, wench, thou must be gone; thou art
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O you immortal gods! I will not go.
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Thou must.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I will not, uncle. I have forgot my father;
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Do, do.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Tear my bright hair, and scratch my praised cheeks,
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Tear my bright hair, and scratch my praised cheeks,
    Crack my clear voice with sobs and break my heart,
    With sounding 'Troilus.' I will not go from Troy.
    Exeunt
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. It is great morning; and the hour prefix'd
  TROILUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Walk into her house.
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. I know what 'tis to love,
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. I know what 'tis to love,
    And would, as I shall pity, I could help!
    Please you walk in, my lords.                              Exeunt
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Be moderate, be moderate.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why tell you me of moderation?
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why tell you me of moderation?
    The grief is fine, full, perfect, that I taste,
    And violenteth in a sense as strong
    As that which causeth it. How can I moderate it?
    If I could temporize with my affections
    Or brew it to a weak and colder palate,
    The like allayment could I give my grief.
    My love admits no qualifying dross;
    No more my grief, in such a precious loss.
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Here, here, here he comes. Ah, sweet ducks!
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O Troilus! Troilus! [Embracing him]
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. What a pair of spectacles is here! Let me embrace too. 'O
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Cressid, I love thee in so strain'd a purity
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Have the gods envy?
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Ay, ay, ay; 'tis too plain a case.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. And is it true that I must go from Troy?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. A hateful truth.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. What, and from Troilus too?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. From Troy and Troilus.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Is't possible?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. And suddenly; where injury of chance
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. [Within] My lord, is the lady ready?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hark! you are call'd. Some say the Genius so
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Where are my tears? Rain, to lay this wind, or my heart
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I must then to the Grecians?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. No remedy.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. A woeful Cressid 'mongst the merry Greeks!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hear me, my love. Be thou but true of heart-
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I true! how now! What wicked deem is this?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Nay, we must use expostulation kindly,
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O, you shall be expos'd, my lord, to dangers
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. And I'll grow friend with danger. Wear this sleeve.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. And you this glove. When shall I see you?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. I will corrupt the Grecian sentinels
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O heavens! 'Be true' again!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hear why I speak it, love.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O heavens! you love me not.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Die I a villain, then!
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Do you think I will?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. No.
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. [Within] Nay, good my lord!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Come, kiss; and let us part.
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. [Within] Brother Troilus!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Good brother, come you hither;
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. My lord, will you be true?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Who, I? Alas, it is my vice, my fault!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Who, I? Alas, it is my vice, my fault!
    Whiles others fish with craft for great opinion,
    I with great truth catch mere simplicity;
    Whilst some with cunning gild their copper crowns,
    With truth and plainness I do wear mine bare.
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Fair Lady Cressid,
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Grecian, thou dost not use me courteously
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. O, be not mov'd, Prince Troilus.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Come, to the port. I'll tell thee, Diomed,
  TROILUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Come, to the port. I'll tell thee, Diomed,
    This brave shall oft make thee to hide thy head.
    Lady, give me your hand; and, as we walk,
    To our own selves bend we our needful talk.
                               Exeunt TROILUS, CRESSIDA, and DIOMEDES
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. Hark! Hector's trumpet.
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. How have we spent this morning!
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. 'Tis Troilus' fault. Come, come to field with him.
  DEIPHOBUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IPHOBUS. Let us make ready straight.
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Yea, with a bridegroom's fresh alacrity
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Yea, with a bridegroom's fresh alacrity
    Let us address to tend on Hector's heels.
    The glory of our Troy doth this day lie
    On his fair worth and single chivalry.                     Exeunt
  AGAMEMNON. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Here art thou in appointment fresh and fair,
  AJAX. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Thou, trumpet, there's my purse.
  ULYSSES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. No trumpet answers.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. 'Tis but early days.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Is not yond Diomed, with Calchas' daughter?
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. 'Tis he, I ken the manner of his gait:
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Is this the lady Cressid?
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Even she.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Most dearly welcome to the Greeks, sweet lady.
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Our general doth salute you with a kiss.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Yet is the kindness but particular;
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. And very courtly counsel: I'll begin.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. I'll take that winter from your lips, fair lady.
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. I had good argument for kissing once.
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. But that's no argument for kissing now;
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O deadly gall, and theme of all our scorns!
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. The first was Menelaus' kiss; this, mine-
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. O, this is trim!
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. Paris and I kiss evermore for him.
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. I'll have my kiss, sir. Lady, by your leave.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. In kissing, do you render or receive?
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. Both take and give.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I'll make my match to live,
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. I'll give you boot; I'll give you three for one.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. You are an odd man; give even or give none.
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. An odd man, lady? Every man is odd.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. No, Paris is not; for you know 'tis true
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. You fillip me o' th' head.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. No, I'll be sworn.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. It were no match, your nail against his horn.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. You may.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. I do desire it.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why, beg then.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Why then, for Venus' sake give me a kiss
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I am your debtor; claim it when 'tis due.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Never's my day, and then a kiss of you.
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Lady, a word. I'll bring you to your father.
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Lady, a word. I'll bring you to your father.
                                                   Exit with CRESSIDA
  NESTOR. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
STOR. A woman of quick sense.
  ULYSSES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Fie, fie upon her!
  ALL. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
L. The Troyans' trumpet.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Yonder comes the troop.
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Hail, all the state of Greece! What shall be done
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Which way would Hector have it?
  AENEAS.

11

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. First, all you peers of Greece, go to my tent;
    There in the full convive we; afterwards,
    As Hector's leisure and your bounties shall
    Concur together, severally entreat him.
    Beat loud the tambourines, let the trumpets blow,
    That this great soldier may his welcome know.
                                   Exeunt all but TROILUS and ULYSSES
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS

DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA

PARIS

PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OILUS. O, sir, to such as boasting show their scars
    A mock is due. Will you walk on, my lord?
    She was belov'd, she lov'd; she is, and doth;
    But still sweet love is food for fortune's tooth.          Exeunt
  ACHILLES.

AENEAS

PATROCLUS

  PATROCLUS.

  THERSITES.

  PATROCLUS.

  PATROCLUS.

  PATROCLUS.

  THERSITES. 
12

PARIS

PRIAM

AJAX

THERSITES
CASSANDRA

  ACHILLES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite
    From my great purpose in to-morrow's battle.
    Here is a letter from Queen Hecuba,
    A token from her daughter, my fair love,
    Both taxing me and gaging me to keep
    An oath that I have sworn. I will not break it.
    Fall Greeks; fail fame; honour or go or stay;
    My major vow lies here, this I'll obey.
    Come, come, Thersites, help to trim my tent;
    This night in banqueting must all be spent.
    Away, Patroclus!                              Exit with PATROCLUS
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. With too much blood and too little brain these two may
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. With too much blood and too little brain these two may
    run mad; but, if with too much brain and to little blood they do,
    I'll be a curer of madmen. Here's Agamemnon, an honest fellow
    enough, and one that loves quails, but he has not so much brain
    as ear-wax; and the goodly transformation of Jupiter there, his
    brother, the bull, the primitive statue and oblique memorial of
    cuckolds, a thrifty shoeing-horn in a chain, hanging at his
    brother's leg-to what form but that he is, should wit larded with
    malice, and malice forced with wit, turn him to? To an ass, were
    nothing: he is both ass and ox. To an ox, were nothing: he is both
    ox and ass. To be a dog, a mule, a cat, a fitchew, a toad, a
    lizard, an owl, a put-tock, or a herring without a roe, I would
    not care; but to be Menelaus, I would conspire against destiny.
    Ask me not what I would be, if I were not Thersites; for I care
    not to be the louse of a lazar, so I were not Menelaus. Hey-day!
    sprites and fires!
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. We go wrong, we go wrong.
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS

AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AX. No, yonder 'tis;
  HECTOR.

  THERSITES. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. That same Diomed's a false-hearted rogue, a most unjust
  THERSITES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. That same Diomed's a false-hearted rogue, a most unjust
    knave; I will no more trust him when he leers than I will a
    serpent when he hisses. He will spend his mouth and promise, like
    Brabbler the hound; but when he performs, astronomers foretell
    it: it is prodigious, there will come some change; the sun
    borrows of the moon when Diomed keeps his word. I will rather
    leave to see Hector than not to dog him. They say he keeps a
    Troyan drab, and uses the traitor Calchas' tent. I'll after.
    Nothing but lechery! All incontinent varlets!                Exit
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. What, are you up here, ho? Speak.
  CALCHAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
LCHAS. [Within] Who calls?
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Diomed. Calchas, I think. Where's your daughter?
  CALCHAS.

TROILUS

  DIOMEDES.

  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS

PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Fear me not, my lord;
    I will not be myself, nor have cognition
    Of what I feel. I am all patience.
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM

ACHILLES

CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Whose was't?
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. It is no matter, now I ha't again.
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Now she sharpens. Well said, whetstone.
  DIOMEDES.

  CRESSIDA.

  DIOMEDES.

  DIOMEDES.

  CRESSIDA.

  DIOMEDES.

  TROILUS.

AJAX
TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  CRESSIDA.

AJAX
TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  DIOMEDES.

  CRESSIDA.

ESSIDA. You shall not go. One cannot speak a word
  DIOMEDES.

CASSANDRA

  DIOMEDES.

  CRESSIDA.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  DIOMEDES. 
12

AJAX
TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Good night. I prithee come.                 Exit DIOMEDES
  THERSITES. 
11

HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. A proof of strength she could not publish more,
  ULYSSES.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

PRIAM

AJAX

ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  ULYSSES.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

AJAX

PARIS

PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Most sure she was.
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Why, my negation hath no taste of madness.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Nor mine, my lord. Cressid was here but now.
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Let it not be believ'd for womanhood.
  ULYSSES. 
11

ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. What hath she done, Prince, that can soil our mothers?
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Nothing at all, unless that this were she.
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Will 'a swagger himself out on's own eyes?
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. This she? No; this is Diomed's Cressida.
  ULYSSES. 
11

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. May worthy Troilus be half-attach'd
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Ay, Greek; and that shall be divulged well
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. He'll tickle it for his concupy.
  TROILUS. 
11

PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O, contain yourself;
    Your passion draws ears hither.
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. I have been seeking you this hour, my lord.
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Have with you, Prince. My courteous lord, adieu.
  ULYSSES. 
11

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. I'll bring you to the gates.
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Accept distracted thanks.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Accept distracted thanks.
            Exeunt TROILUS, AENEAS. and ULYSSES
  THERSITES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Would I could meet that rogue Diomed! I would croak like
  THERSITES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Would I could meet that rogue Diomed! I would croak like
    a raven; I would bode, I would bode. Patroclus will give me
    anything for the intelligence of this whore; the parrot will not
    do more for an almond than he for a commodious drab. Lechery,
    lechery! Still wars and lechery! Nothing else holds fashion. A
    burning devil take them!                                     Exit
  ANDROMACHE. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
DROMACHE. When was my lord so much ungently temper'd
  HECTOR. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. You train me to offend you; get you in.
  ANDROMACHE. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
DROMACHE. My dreams will, sure, prove ominous to the day.
  HECTOR. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. No more, I say.
  CASSANDRA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. Where is my brother Hector?
  ANDROMACHE. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
DROMACHE. Here, sister, arm'd, and bloody in intent.
  CASSANDRA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. O, 'tis true!
  HECTOR. 
10
AENEAS

PANDARUS
PRIAM

AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Ho! bid my trumpet sound.
  CASSANDRA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. No notes of sally, for the heavens, sweet brother!
  HECTOR. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Be gone, I say. The gods have heard me swear.
  CASSANDRA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. The gods are deaf to hot and peevish vows;
  ANDROMACHE. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
DROMACHE. O, be persuaded! Do not count it holy
  CASSANDRA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. It is the purpose that makes strong the vow;
  HECTOR. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Hold you still, I say.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Hold you still, I say.
    Mine honour keeps the weather of my fate.
    Life every man holds dear; but the dear man
    Holds honour far more precious dear than life.
  ANDROMACHE. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
DROMACHE. Cassandra, call my father to persuade.
  ANDROMACHE. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
DROMACHE. Cassandra, call my father to persuade.
                                                       Exit CASSANDRA
  HECTOR. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. No, faith, young Troilus; doff thy harness, youth;
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Brother, you have a vice of mercy in you
  HECTOR. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. What vice is that, good Troilus?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. When many times the captive Grecian falls,
  HECTOR. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. O, 'tis fair play!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Fool's play, by heaven, Hector.
  HECTOR. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. How now! how now!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. For th' love of all the gods,
  HECTOR. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. Fie, savage, fie!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Hector, then 'tis wars.
  HECTOR. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. Troilus, I would not have you fight to-day.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Who should withhold me?
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Who should withhold me?
    Not fate, obedience, nor the hand of Mars
    Beck'ning with fiery truncheon my retire;
    Not Priamus and Hecuba on knees,
    Their eyes o'ergalled with recourse of tears;
    Nor you, my brother, with your true sword drawn,
    Oppos'd to hinder me, should stop my way,
    But by my ruin.
  CASSANDRA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. Lay hold upon him, Priam, hold him fast;
  PRIAM. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IAM. Come, Hector, come, go back.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Aeneas is a-field;
  PRIAM. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IAM. Ay, but thou shalt not go.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I must not break my faith.
  CASSANDRA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. O Priam, yield not to him!
  ANDROMACHE. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
DROMACHE. Do not, dear father.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Andromache, I am offended with you.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Andromache, I am offended with you.
    Upon the love you bear me, get you in.
                                                      Exit ANDROMACHE
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. This foolish, dreaming, superstitious girl
  CASSANDRA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. O, farewell, dear Hector!
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Away, away!
  CASSANDRA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. Farewell!-yet, soft! Hector, I take my leave.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. You are amaz'd, my liege, at her exclaim.
  PRIAM. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IAM. Farewell. The gods with safety stand about thee!
  PRIAM. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IAM. Farewell. The gods with safety stand about thee!
                           Exeunt severally PRIAM and HECTOR. Alarums
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. They are at it, hark! Proud Diomed, believe,
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. They are at it, hark! Proud Diomed, believe,
    I come to lose my arm or win my sleeve.
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Do you hear, my lord? Do you hear?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. What now?
  PANDARUS. 
10

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Here's a letter come from yond poor girl.
  TROILUS. 
10

  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. A whoreson tisick, a whoreson rascally tisick so troubles
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Words, words, mere words, no matter from the heart;
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Words, words, mere words, no matter from the heart;
    Th' effect doth operate another way.
                                                 [Tearing the letter]
    Go, wind, to wind, there turn and change together.
    My love with words and errors still she feeds,
    But edifies another with her deeds.              Exeunt severally
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Now they are clapper-clawing one another; I'll go look
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Now they are clapper-clawing one another; I'll go look
    on. That dissembling abominable varlet, Diomed, has got that same
    scurvy doting foolish young knave's sleeve of Troy there in his
    helm. I would fain see them meet, that that same young Troyan ass
    that loves the whore there might send that Greekish whoremasterly
    villain with the sleeve back to the dissembling luxurious drab of
    a sleeve-less errand. A th' t'other side, the policy of those
    crafty swearing rascals-that stale old mouse-eaten dry cheese,
    Nestor, and that same dog-fox, Ulysses -is not prov'd worth a
    blackberry. They set me up, in policy, that mongrel cur, Ajax,
    against that dog of as bad a kind, Achilles; and now is the cur,
    Ajax prouder than the cur Achilles, and will not arm to-day;
    whereupon the Grecians begin to proclaim barbarism, and policy
    grows into an ill opinion.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Fly not; for shouldst thou take the river Styx
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Thou dost miscall retire.
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Hold thy whore, Grecian; now for thy whore,
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Hold thy whore, Grecian; now for thy whore,
    Troyan-now the sleeve, now the sleeve!
                                 Exeunt TROILUS and DIOMEDES fighting
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. What art thou, Greek? Art thou for Hector's match?
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. No, no-I am a rascal; a scurvy railing knave; a very
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I do believe thee. Live.                               Exit
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. God-a-mercy, that thou wilt believe me; but a plague
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. God-a-mercy, that thou wilt believe me; but a plague
    break thy neck for frighting me! What's become of the wenching
    rogues? I think they have swallowed one another. I would laugh at
    that miracle. Yet, in a sort, lechery eats itself. I'll seek
    them.                                                        Exit
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Go, go, my servant, take thou Troilus' horse;
  SERVANT. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RVANT. I go, my lord.                                        Exit
  AGAMEMNON. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Renew, renew! The fierce Polydamus
  AGAMEMNON. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Renew, renew! The fierce Polydamus
    Hath beat down enon; bastard Margarelon
    Hath Doreus prisoner,
    And stands colossus-wise, waving his beam,
    Upon the pashed corses of the kings
    Epistrophus and Cedius. Polixenes is slain;
    Amphimacus and Thoas deadly hurt;
    Patroclus ta'en, or slain; and Palamedes
    Sore hurt and bruis'd. The dreadful Sagittary
    Appals our numbers. Haste we, Diomed,
    To reinforcement, or we perish all.
  NESTOR. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Go, bear Patroclus' body to Achilles,
  NESTOR. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Go, bear Patroclus' body to Achilles,
    And bid the snail-pac'd Ajax arm for shame.
    There is a thousand Hectors in the field;
    Now here he fights on Galathe his horse,
    And there lacks work; anon he's there afoot,
    And there they fly or die, like scaled sculls
    Before the belching whale; then is he yonder,
    And there the strawy Greeks, ripe for his edge,
    Fall down before him like the mower's swath.
    Here, there, and everywhere, he leaves and takes;
    Dexterity so obeying appetite
    That what he will he does, and does so much
    That proof is call'd impossibility.
  ULYSSES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O, courage, courage, courage, Princes! Great
  ULYSSES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O, courage, courage, courage, Princes! Great
    Achilles Is arming, weeping, cursing, vowing vengeance.
    Patroclus' wounds have rous'd his drowsy blood,
    Together with his mangled Myrmidons,
    That noseless, handless, hack'd and chipp'd, come to
    him, Crying on Hector. Ajax hath lost a friend
    And foams at mouth, and he is arm'd and at it,
    Roaring for Troilus; who hath done to-day
    Mad and fantastic execution,
    Engaging and redeeming of himself
    With such a careless force and forceless care
    As if that luck, in very spite of cunning,
    Bade him win all.
  AJAX. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Troilus! thou coward Troilus!                            Exit
  DIOMEDES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES

AJAX

THERSITES
NESTOR

OMEDES. Ay, there, there.
  NESTOR. 
13

THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA

  ACHILLES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Where is this Hector?
  ACHILLES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Where is this Hector?
    Come, come, thou boy-queller, show thy face;
    Know what it is to meet Achilles angry.
    Hector! where's Hector? I will none but Hector.            Exeunt
  AJAX. 
13
AENEAS

  DIOMEDES.

CASSANDRA
AX. Were I the general, thou shouldst have my office
    Ere that correction. Troilus, I say! What, Troilus!
  TROILUS.

  TROILUS.

  HECTOR.

  ACHILLES.

14
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Fare thee well.
    I would have been much more a fresher man,
    Had I expected thee.
  TROILUS. 
14
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES

AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Ajax hath ta'en Aeneas. Shall it be?
  HECTOR. 
14
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Stand, stand, thou Greek; thou art a goodly mark.
  HECTOR. 
14
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Stand, stand, thou Greek; thou art a goodly mark.
    No? wilt thou not? I like thy armour well;
    I'll frush it and unlock the rivets all
    But I'll be master of it. Wilt thou not, beast, abide?
    Why then, fly on; I'll hunt thee for thy hide.             Exeunt
  ACHILLES. 
14
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Come here about me, you my Myrmidons;
  ACHILLES. 
15
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Come here about me, you my Myrmidons;
    Mark what I say. Attend me where I wheel;
    Strike not a stroke, but keep yourselves in breath;
    And when I have the bloody Hector found,
    Empale him with your weapons round about;
    In fellest manner execute your arms.
    Follow me, sirs, and my proceedings eye.
    It is decreed Hector the great must die.                   Exeunt
  THERSITES. 
15
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. The cuckold and the cuckold-maker are at it. Now, bull!
  THERSITES. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. The cuckold and the cuckold-maker are at it. Now, bull!
    now, dog! 'Loo, Paris, 'loo! now my double-horn'd Spartan! 'loo,
    Paris, 'loo! The bull has the game. Ware horns, ho!
                                            Exeunt PARIS and MENELAUS
  MARGARELON. 
15
MARGARELON

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RGARELON. Turn, slave, and fight.
  THERSITES. 
15
MARGARELON

  MARGARELON.

MARGARELON

  HECTOR. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Most putrified core so fair without,
  HECTOR. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Most putrified core so fair without,
    Thy goodly armour thus hath cost thy life.
    Now is my day's work done; I'll take good breath:
    Rest, sword; thou hast thy fill of blood and death!
  ACHILLES. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Look, Hector, how the sun begins to set;
  HECTOR. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I am unarm'd; forego this vantage, Greek.
  ACHILLES. 
15
MARGARELON

CASSANDRA
HILLES. Strike, fellows, strike; this is the man I seek.
  MYRMIDON. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX

HILLES. The dragon wing of night o'erspreads the earth
    And, stickler-like, the armies separates.
    My half-supp'd sword, that frankly would have fed,
    Pleas'd with this dainty bait, thus goes to bed.
                                                 [Sheathes his sword]
    Come, tie his body to my horse's tail;
    Along the field I will the Troyan trail.                   Exeunt
  AGAMEMNON.

CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. March patiently along. Let one be sent
    To pray Achilles see us at our tent.
    If in his death the gods have us befriended;
    Great Troy is ours, and our sharp wars are ended.
    Exeunt

  TROILUS. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. You understand me not that tell me so.
    I do not speak of flight, of fear of death,
    But dare all imminence that gods and men
    Address their dangers in. Hector is gone.
    Who shall tell Priam so, or Hecuba?
    Let him that will a screech-owl aye be call'd
    Go in to Troy, and say there 'Hector's dead.'
    There is a word will Priam turn to stone;
    Make wells and Niobes of the maids and wives,
    Cold statues of the youth; and, in a word,
    Scare Troy out of itself. But, march away;
    Hector is dead; there is no more to say.
    Stay yet. You vile abominable tents,
    Thus proudly pight upon our Phrygian plains,
    Let Titan rise as early as he dare,
    I'll through and through you. And, thou great-siz'd coward,
    No space of earth shall sunder our two hates;
    I'll haunt thee like a wicked conscience still,
    That mouldeth goblins swift as frenzy's thoughts.
    Strike a free march to Troy. With comfort go;
    Hope of revenge shall hide our inward woe.
  PANDARUS. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES

1
TROILUS
ESSIDA, daughter to Calchas
                          SCENE:
             Troy and the Greek camp before it
                  TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
                        PROLOGUE
    In Troy, there lies the scene. From isles of Greece
    The princes orgillous, their high blood chaf'd,
    Have to the port of Athens sent their ships
    Fraught with the ministers and instruments
    Of cruel war. Sixty and nine that wore
    Their crownets regal from th' Athenian bay
    Put forth toward Phrygia; and their vow is made
    To ransack Troy, within whose strong immures
    The ravish'd Helen, Menelaus' queen,
    With wanton Paris sleeps-and that's the quarrel.
    To Tenedos they come,
    And the deep-drawing barks do there disgorge
    Their war-like fraughtage. Now on Dardan plains
    The fresh and yet unbruised Greeks do pitch
    Their brave pavilions: Priam's six-gated city,
    Dardan, and Tymbria, Helias, Chetas, Troien,
    And Antenorides, with massy staples
    And corresponsive and fulfilling bolts,
    Sperr up the sons of Troy.
    Now expectation, tickling skittish spirits
    On one and other side, Troyan and Greek,
    Sets all on hazard-and hither am I come
    A Prologue arm'd, but not in confidence
    Of author's pen or actor's voice, but suited
    In like conditions as our argument,
    To tell you, fair beholders, that our play
    Leaps o'er the vaunt and firstlings of those broils,
    Beginning in the middle; starting thence away,
    To what may be digested in a play.
    Like or find fault; do as your pleasures are;
    Now good or bad, 'tis but the chance of war.
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. Call here my varlet; I'll unarm again.
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. Will this gear ne'er be mended?
  TROILUS. 
1

  PANDARUS.

  TROILUS.

  TROILUS.

  PANDARUS.

TROILUS

  TROILUS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
OILUS. Peace, you ungracious clamours! Peace, rude sounds!
    Fools on both sides! Helen must needs be fair,
    When with your blood you daily paint her thus.
    I cannot fight upon this argument;
    It is too starv'd a subject for my sword.
    But Pandarus-O gods, how do you plague me!
    I cannot come to Cressid but by Pandar;
    And he's as tetchy to be woo'd to woo
    As she is stubborn-chaste against all suit.
    Tell me, Apollo, for thy Daphne's love,
    What Cressid is, what Pandar, and what we?
    Her bed is India; there she lies, a pearl;
    Between our Ilium and where she resides
    Let it be call'd the wild and wand'ring flood;
    Ourself the merchant, and this sailing Pandar
    Our doubtful hope, our convoy, and our bark.
  AENEAS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
NEAS. How now, Prince Troilus! Wherefore not afield?
  TROILUS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
OILUS. Because not there. This woman's answer sorts,
  AENEAS. 
2

AENEAS

  TROILUS.

  AENEAS.

  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. By the same token, you are a bawd.
                                                        Exit PANDARUS
    Words, vows, gifts, tears, and love's full sacrifice,
    He offers in another's enterprise;
    But more in Troilus thousand-fold I see
    Than in the glass of Pandar's praise may be,
    Yet hold I off. Women are angels, wooing:
    Things won are done; joy's soul lies in the doing.
    That she belov'd knows nought that knows not this:
    Men prize the thing ungain'd more than it is.
    That she was never yet that ever knew
    Love got so sweet as when desire did sue;
    Therefore this maxim out of love I teach:
    Achievement is command; ungain'd, beseech.
    Then though my heart's content firm love doth bear,
    Nothing of that shall from mine eyes appear.                 Exit
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

  NESTOR.

AMEMNON. Fair Lord Aeneas, let me touch your hand;
    To our pavilion shall I lead you, first.
    Achilles shall have word of this intent;
    So shall each lord of Greece, from tent to tent.
    Yourself shall feast with us before you go,
    And find the welcome of a noble foe.
                                    Exeunt all but ULYSSES and NESTOR
  ULYSSES.

TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. Now, Ulysses, I begin to relish thy advice;
    And I will give a taste thereof forthwith
    To Agamemnon. Go we to him straight.
    Two curs shall tame each other: pride alone
    Must tarre the mastiffs on, as 'twere their bone.          Exeunt

CRESSIDA

  THERSITES. 
5
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Mars his idiot! Do, rudeness; do, camel; do, do.
  ACHILLES. 
5
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA
HILLES. Why, how now, Ajax! Wherefore do you thus?
  THERSITES. 
5
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. You see him there, do you?
  ACHILLES. 
5
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA
HILLES. Ay; what's the matter?
  THERSITES. 
5
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Nay, look upon him.
  ACHILLES. 
5
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA
HILLES. So I do. What's the matter?
  THERSITES. 
5
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Nay, but regard him well.
  ACHILLES. 
5
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA
HILLES. Well! why, so I do.
  THERSITES.

AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. But yet you look not well upon him; for who some ever
  ACHILLES.

  THERSITES.

ACHILLES

  AJAX.

AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS

  THERSITES.

  ACHILLES.

  ACHILLES.

  AJAX.

  ACHILLES. 
5

AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS

  THERSITES. 
5
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA

  PATROCLUS. 
5

AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS

  ACHILLES.

  AJAX. 
5

ACHILLES
TROILUS

  THERSITES.

  AJAX.

ACHILLES

  THERSITES.

  ACHILLES.

TROILUS

  HECTOR. 
8
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I am yours,
    You valiant offspring of great Priamus.
    I have a roisting challenge sent amongst
    The dull and factious nobles of the Greeks
    Will strike amazement to their drowsy spirits.
    I was advertis'd their great general slept,
    Whilst emulation in the army crept.
    This, I presume, will wake him.                            Exeunt
  THERSITES. 
8
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. How now, Thersites! What, lost in the labyrinth of thy
  THERSITES. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. How now, Thersites! What, lost in the labyrinth of thy
    fury? Shall the elephant Ajax carry it thus? He beats me, and I
    rail at him. O worthy satisfaction! Would it were otherwise: that
    I could beat him, whilst he rail'd at me! 'Sfoot, I'll learn to
    conjure and raise devils, but I'll see some issue of my spiteful
    execrations. Then there's Achilles, a rare engineer! If Troy be
    not taken till these two undermine it, the walls will stand till
    they fall of themselves. O thou great thunder-darter of Olympus,
    forget that thou art Jove, the king of gods, and, Mercury, lose
    all the serpentine craft of thy caduceus, if ye take not that
    little little less-than-little wit from them that they have!
    which short-arm'd ignorance itself knows is so abundant scarce,
    it will not in circumvention deliver a fly from a spider without
    drawing their massy irons and cutting the web. After this, the
    vengeance on the whole camp! or, rather, the Neapolitan
    bone-ache! for that, methinks, is the curse depending on those
    that war for a placket. I have said my prayers; and devil Envy
    say 'Amen.' What ho! my Lord Achilles!
  PATROCLUS. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. Who's there? Thersites! Good Thersites, come in and
  THERSITES. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. If I could 'a rememb'red a gilt counterfeit, thou
  PATROCLUS.

CASSANDRA

  THERSITES. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Here is such patchery, such juggling, and such knavery.
    All the argument is a whore and a cuckold-a good quarrel to draw
    emulous factions and bleed to death upon. Now the dry serpigo on
    the subject, and war and lechery confound all!               Exit
  AGAMEMNON. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM

    We come to speak with him. Ulysses, enter you.

  AJAX. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. What is he more than another?
  AGAMEMNON. 
9

AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. No more than what he thinks he is.
  AJAX.

PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Is he so much? Do you not think he thinks himself a better
  AGAMEMNON.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

PRIAM

TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Will you subscribe his thought and say he is?
  AGAMEMNON.

PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  AJAX.

AGAMEMNON

PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Why should a man be proud? How doth pride grow? I know not
  AGAMEMNON. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Your mind is the clearer, Ajax, and your virtues the
  AGAMEMNON. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Your mind is the clearer, Ajax, and your virtues the
    fairer. He that is proud eats up himself. Pride is his own glass,
    his own trumpet, his own chronicle; and whatever praises itself
    but in the deed devours the deed in the praise.
  AJAX. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. I do hate a proud man as I do hate the engend'ring of toads.
  NESTOR. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. [Aside] And yet he loves himself: is't not strange?
  ULYSSES. 
10

AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Achilles will not to the field to-morrow.

CASSANDRA
OMEDES. [Aside] And how his silence drinks up this applause!

CASSANDRA

CASSANDRA

TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. An 'a be proud with me I'll pheeze his pride.

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Go we to council. Let Achilles sleep.
    Light boats sail swift, though greater hulks draw deep.
    Exeunt
  PANDARUS.

CASSANDRA
LEN. My Lord Pandarus, honey-sweet lord-
  PANDARUS.

  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. I am giddy; expectation whirls me round.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. I am giddy; expectation whirls me round.
    Th' imaginary relish is so sweet
    That it enchants my sense; what will it be
    When that the wat'ry palate tastes indeed
    Love's thrice-repured nectar? Death, I fear me;
    Swooning destruction; or some joy too fine,
    Too subtle-potent, tun'd too sharp in sweetness,
    For the capacity of my ruder powers.
    I fear it much; and I do fear besides
    That I shall lose distinction in my joys;
    As doth a battle, when they charge on heaps
    The enemy flying.
  PANDARUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. She's making her ready, she'll come straight; you must be
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Even such a passion doth embrace my bosom.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Even such a passion doth embrace my bosom.
    My heart beats thicker than a feverous pulse,
    And all my powers do their bestowing lose,
    Like vassalage at unawares encount'ring
    The eye of majesty.
  PANDARUS. 
12

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Sir, mine own company.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. You cannot shun yourself.
  CRESSIDA. 
12

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Let me go and try.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Well know they what they speak that speak so wisely.
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Perchance, my lord, I show more craft than love;
  TROILUS. 
12

ULYSSES

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. O that I thought it could be in a woman-
  CRESSIDA.

  TROILUS.

  CRESSIDA.

ESSIDA. Prophet may you be!
  PANDARUS.

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Go to, a bargain made; seal it, seal it; I'll be the
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS

ULYSSES

PRIAM

THERSITES

  CRESSIDA.

12
AENEAS

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Amen. Whereupon I will show you a chamber
  PANDARUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Amen. Whereupon I will show you a chamber
    and a bed; which bed, because it shall not speak of your
    pretty encounters, press it to death. Away!
    And Cupid grant all tongue-tied maidens here,
    Bed, chamber, pander, to provide this gear!                Exeunt
  CALCHAS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
LCHAS. Now, Princes, for the service I have done,
  AGAMEMNON. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. What wouldst thou of us, Troyan? Make demand.
  CALCHAS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
LCHAS. You have a Troyan prisoner call'd Antenor,
  AGAMEMNON. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Let Diomedes bear him,
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. This shall I undertake; and 'tis a burden
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. This shall I undertake; and 'tis a burden
    Which I am proud to bear.
                                          Exeunt DIOMEDES and CALCHAS
  ULYSSES. 
12
AENEAS

PATROCLUS

TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  AGAMEMNON.

CASSANDRA

  ACHILLES.

TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  AGAMEMNON.

PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. What says Achilles? Would he aught with us?
  NESTOR.

TROILUS

  ACHILLES.

  ACHILLES.

  ACHILLES.

  ACHILLES.

  PATROCLUS.

PARIS

PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. O, then, beware:
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Go call Thersites hither, sweet Patroclus.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Go call Thersites hither, sweet Patroclus.
    I'll send the fool to Ajax, and desire him
    T' invite the Troyan lords, after the combat,
    To see us here unarm'd. I have a woman's longing,
    An appetite that I am sick withal,
    To see great Hector in his weeds of peace;
    To talk with him, and to behold his visage,
    Even to my full of view.
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. A wonder!
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. What?
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Ajax goes up and down the field asking for himself.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA

HILLES. How so?
  THERSITES.

TROILUS

  ACHILLES.

TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. How can that be?
  THERSITES.

THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  ACHILLES.

  ACHILLES.

TROILUS

CASSANDRA

  THERSITES. 
11

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. No, but he's out a tune thus. What music will be in him
  ACHILLES.

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Come, thou shalt bear a letter to him straight.
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Let me carry another to his horse; for that's the more
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. My mind is troubled, like a fountain stirr'd;
  ACHILLES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. My mind is troubled, like a fountain stirr'd;
    And I myself see not the bottom of it.
                                        Exeunt ACHILLES and PATROCLUS
  THERSITES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Would the fountain of your mind were clear again, that I
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. See, ho! Who is that there?
  DEIPHOBUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IPHOBUS. It is the Lord Aeneas.
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Is the Prince there in person?
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. That's my mind too. Good morrow, Lord Aeneas.
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. A valiant Greek, Aeneas -take his hand:
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Health to you, valiant sir,
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. The one and other Diomed embraces.
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. And thou shalt hunt a lion, that will fly
  DIOMEDES. 
10

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. We sympathise. Jove let Aeneas live,
  AENEAS. 
10

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. We know each other well.
  PARIS.

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. This is the most despiteful'st gentle greeting
  AENEAS. 
10

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. I was sent for to the King; but why, I know not.
  PARIS. 
10

CASSANDRA
RIS. His purpose meets you: 'twas to bring this Greek
  AENEAS.

CASSANDRA

CASSANDRA

10

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. She's bitter to her country. Hear me, Paris:
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. Fair Diomed, you do as chapmen do,
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. Fair Diomed, you do as chapmen do,
    Dispraise the thing that you desire to buy;
    But we in silence hold this virtue well:
    We'll not commend what we intend to sell.
    Here lies our way.                                         Exeunt
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Dear, trouble not yourself; the morn is cold.
  CRESSIDA.

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Then, sweet my lord, I'll call mine uncle down;
  TROILUS. 
10

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  CRESSIDA.

CRESSIDA

CASSANDRA

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  CRESSIDA.

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Beshrew the witch! with venomous wights she stays
  CRESSIDA. 
10

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

10

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. [Within] What's all the doors open here?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. It is your uncle.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. A pestilence on him! Now will he be mocking.
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. How now, how now! How go maidenheads?
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Go hang yourself, you naughty mocking uncle.
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. To do what? to do what? Let her say what.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Come, come, beshrew your heart! You'll ne'er be good,
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Ha, ha! Alas, poor wretch! a poor capocchia! hast not
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Did not I tell you? Would he were knock'd i' th' head!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Ha! ha!
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Come, you are deceiv'd, I think of no such thing.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Come, you are deceiv'd, I think of no such thing.
    How earnestly they knock! Pray you come in:
    I would not for half Troy have you seen here.
                                          Exeunt TROILUS and CRESSIDA
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Who's there? What's the matter? Will you beat down the
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Who's there? What's the matter? Will you beat down the
    door? How now? What's the matter?
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Good morrow, lord, good morrow.
  PANDARUS.

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Who's there? My lord Aeneas? By my troth,
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  PANDARUS. 
9

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  AENEAS. 
9

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Come, he is here, my lord; do not deny him.
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Is he here, say you? It's more than I know, I'll be
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Who!-nay, then. Come, come, you'll do him wrong ere you are
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Who!-nay, then. Come, come, you'll do him wrong ere you are
    ware; you'll be so true to him to be false to him. Do not you
    know of him, but yet go fetch him hither; go.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. How now! What's the matter?
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. My lord, I scarce have leisure to salute you,
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Is it so concluded?
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. By Priam, and the general state of Troy.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. How my achievements mock me!
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Good, good, my lord, the secrets of neighbour Pandar
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Good, good, my lord, the secrets of neighbour Pandar
    Have not more gift in taciturnity.
                                            Exeunt TROILUS and AENEAS
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Is't possible? No sooner got but lost? The devil take
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Is't possible? No sooner got but lost? The devil take
    Antenor! The young prince will go mad. A plague upon Antenor! I
    would they had broke's neck.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. How now! What's the matter? Who was here?
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Ah, ah!
  CRESSIDA. 
9
