ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why sigh you so profoundly? Where's my lord? Gone? Tell
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Would I were as deep under the earth as I am above!
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O the gods! What's the matter?
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Pray thee, get thee in. Would thou hadst ne'er been born!
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Good uncle, I beseech you, on my knees I beseech you,
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Thou must be gone, wench, thou must be gone; thou art
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O you immortal gods! I will not go.
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Thou must.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I will not, uncle. I have forgot my father;
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Do, do.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Tear my bright hair, and scratch my praised cheeks,
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Tear my bright hair, and scratch my praised cheeks,
    Crack my clear voice with sobs and break my heart,
    With sounding 'Troilus.' I will not go from Troy.
    Exeunt
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. It is great morning; and the hour prefix'd
  TROILUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Walk into her house.
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. I know what 'tis to love,
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. I know what 'tis to love,
    And would, as I shall pity, I could help!
    Please you walk in, my lords.                              Exeunt
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Be moderate, be moderate.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why tell you me of moderation?
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why tell you me of moderation?
    The grief is fine, full, perfect, that I taste,
    And violenteth in a sense as strong
    As that which causeth it. How can I moderate it?
    If I could temporize with my affections
    Or brew it to a weak and colder palate,
    The like allayment could I give my grief.
    My love admits no qualifying dross;
    No more my grief, in such a precious loss.
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Here, here, here he comes. Ah, sweet ducks!
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O Troilus! Troilus! [Embracing him]
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. What a pair of spectacles is here! Let me embrace too. 'O
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Cressid, I love thee in so strain'd a purity
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Have the gods envy?
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Ay, ay, ay; 'tis too plain a case.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. And is it true that I must go from Troy?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. A hateful truth.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. What, and from Troilus too?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. From Troy and Troilus.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Is't possible?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. And suddenly; where injury of chance
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. [Within] My lord, is the lady ready?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hark! you are call'd. Some say the Genius so
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Where are my tears? Rain, to lay this wind, or my heart
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I must then to the Grecians?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. No remedy.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. A woeful Cressid 'mongst the merry Greeks!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hear me, my love. Be thou but true of heart-
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I true! how now! What wicked deem is this?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Nay, we must use expostulation kindly,
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O, you shall be expos'd, my lord, to dangers
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. And I'll grow friend with danger. Wear this sleeve.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. And you this glove. When shall I see you?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. I will corrupt the Grecian sentinels
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O heavens! 'Be true' again!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hear why I speak it, love.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O heavens! you love me not.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Die I a villain, then!
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Do you think I will?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. No.
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. [Within] Nay, good my lord!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Come, kiss; and let us part.
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. [Within] Brother Troilus!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Good brother, come you hither;
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. My lord, will you be true?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Who, I? Alas, it is my vice, my fault!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Who, I? Alas, it is my vice, my fault!
    Whiles others fish with craft for great opinion,
    I with great truth catch mere simplicity;
    Whilst some with cunning gild their copper crowns,
    With truth and plainness I do wear mine bare.
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Fair Lady Cressid,
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Grecian, thou dost not use me courteously
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. O, be not mov'd, Prince Troilus.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Come, to the port. I'll tell thee, Diomed,
  TROILUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Come, to the port. I'll tell thee, Diomed,
    This brave shall oft make thee to hide thy head.
    Lady, give me your hand; and, as we walk,
    To our own selves bend we our needful talk.
                               Exeunt TROILUS, CRESSIDA, and DIOMEDES
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. Hark! Hector's trumpet.
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. How have we spent this morning!
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. 'Tis Troilus' fault. Come, come to field with him.
  DEIPHOBUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IPHOBUS. Let us make ready straight.
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Yea, with a bridegroom's fresh alacrity
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Yea, with a bridegroom's fresh alacrity
    Let us address to tend on Hector's heels.
    The glory of our Troy doth this day lie
    On his fair worth and single chivalry.                     Exeunt
  AGAMEMNON. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Here art thou in appointment fresh and fair,
  AJAX. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Thou, trumpet, there's my purse.
  ULYSSES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. No trumpet answers.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. 'Tis but early days.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Is not yond Diomed, with Calchas' daughter?
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. 'Tis he, I ken the manner of his gait:
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Is this the lady Cressid?
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Even she.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Most dearly welcome to the Greeks, sweet lady.
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Our general doth salute you with a kiss.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Yet is the kindness but particular;
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. And very courtly counsel: I'll begin.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. I'll take that winter from your lips, fair lady.
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. I had good argument for kissing once.
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. But that's no argument for kissing now;
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O deadly gall, and theme of all our scorns!
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. The first was Menelaus' kiss; this, mine-
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. O, this is trim!
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. Paris and I kiss evermore for him.
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. I'll have my kiss, sir. Lady, by your leave.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. In kissing, do you render or receive?
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. Both take and give.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I'll make my match to live,
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. I'll give you boot; I'll give you three for one.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. You are an odd man; give even or give none.
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. An odd man, lady? Every man is odd.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. No, Paris is not; for you know 'tis true
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. You fillip me o' th' head.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. No, I'll be sworn.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. It were no match, your nail against his horn.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. You may.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. I do desire it.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why, beg then.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Why then, for Venus' sake give me a kiss
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I am your debtor; claim it when 'tis due.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Never's my day, and then a kiss of you.
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Lady, a word. I'll bring you to your father.
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Lady, a word. I'll bring you to your father.
                                                   Exit with CRESSIDA
  NESTOR. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
STOR. A woman of quick sense.
  ULYSSES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Fie, fie upon her!
  ALL. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
L. The Troyans' trumpet.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Yonder comes the troop.
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Hail, all the state of Greece! What shall be done
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Which way would Hector have it?
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. He cares not; he'll obey conditions.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. 'Tis done like Hector; but securely done,
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. If not Achilles, sir,
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. If not Achilles, nothing.
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Therefore Achilles. But whate'er, know this:
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. A maiden battle then? O, I perceive you!
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Here is Sir Diomed. Go, gentle knight,
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. They are oppos'd already.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. What Troyan is that same that looks so heavy?
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. The youngest son of Priam, a true knight;
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. They are in action.
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
STOR. Now, Ajax, hold thine own!
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hector, thou sleep'st;
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. His blows are well dispos'd. There, Ajax!
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. You must no more.
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Princes, enough, so please you.
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AX. I am not warm yet; let us fight again.
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. As Hector pleases.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Why, then will I no more.
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AX. I thank thee, Hector.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Not Neoptolemus so mirable,
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. There is expectance here from both the sides
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. We'll answer it:
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA

  DIOMEDES.

PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. First, all you peers of Greece, go to my tent;
    There in the full convive we; afterwards,
    As Hector's leisure and your bounties shall
    Concur together, severally entreat him.
    Beat loud the tambourines, let the trumpets blow,
    That this great soldier may his welcome know.
                                   Exeunt all but TROILUS and ULYSSES
  TROILUS.

ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OILUS. O, sir, to such as boasting show their scars
    A mock is due. Will you walk on, my lord?
    She was belov'd, she lov'd; she is, and doth;
    But still sweet love is food for fortune's tooth.          Exeunt
  ACHILLES.

  PATROCLUS.

  ACHILLES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite
    From my great purpose in to-morrow's battle.
    Here is a letter from Queen Hecuba,
    A token from her daughter, my fair love,
    Both taxing me and gaging me to keep
    An oath that I have sworn. I will not break it.
    Fall Greeks; fail fame; honour or go or stay;
    My major vow lies here, this I'll obey.
    Come, come, Thersites, help to trim my tent;
    This night in banqueting must all be spent.
    Away, Patroclus!                              Exit with PATROCLUS
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. With too much blood and too little brain these two may
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. With too much blood and too little brain these two may
    run mad; but, if with too much brain and to little blood they do,
    I'll be a curer of madmen. Here's Agamemnon, an honest fellow
    enough, and one that loves quails, but he has not so much brain
    as ear-wax; and the goodly transformation of Jupiter there, his
    brother, the bull, the primitive statue and oblique memorial of
    cuckolds, a thrifty shoeing-horn in a chain, hanging at his
    brother's leg-to what form but that he is, should wit larded with
    malice, and malice forced with wit, turn him to? To an ass, were
    nothing: he is both ass and ox. To an ox, were nothing: he is both
    ox and ass. To be a dog, a mule, a cat, a fitchew, a toad, a
    lizard, an owl, a put-tock, or a herring without a roe, I would
    not care; but to be Menelaus, I would conspire against destiny.
    Ask me not what I would be, if I were not Thersites; for I care
    not to be the louse of a lazar, so I were not Menelaus. Hey-day!
    sprites and fires!
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. We go wrong, we go wrong.
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AX. No, yonder 'tis;
  HECTOR.

ACHILLES
THERSITES

  ULYSSES.

10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Come, come, enter my tent.
  ACHILLES. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Come, come, enter my tent.
                                             Exeunt all but THERSITES
  THERSITES. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. That same Diomed's a false-hearted rogue, a most unjust
  THERSITES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. That same Diomed's a false-hearted rogue, a most unjust
    knave; I will no more trust him when he leers than I will a
    serpent when he hisses. He will spend his mouth and promise, like
    Brabbler the hound; but when he performs, astronomers foretell
    it: it is prodigious, there will come some change; the sun
    borrows of the moon when Diomed keeps his word. I will rather
    leave to see Hector than not to dog him. They say he keeps a
    Troyan drab, and uses the traitor Calchas' tent. I'll after.
    Nothing but lechery! All incontinent varlets!                Exit
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. What, are you up here, ho? Speak.
  CALCHAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
LCHAS. [Within] Who calls?
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Diomed. Calchas, I think. Where's your daughter?
  CALCHAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
LCHAS. [Within] She comes to you.
  ULYSSES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Stand where the torch may not discover us.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Cressid comes forth to him.
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. How now, my charge!
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Now, my sweet guardian! Hark, a word with you.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Yea, so familiar!
  ULYSSES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. She will sing any man at first sight.
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. And any man may sing her, if he can take her cliff;
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Will you remember?
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Remember? Yes.
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Nay, but do, then;
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. What shall she remember?
  ULYSSES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. List!
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Sweet honey Greek, tempt me no more to folly.
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Roguery!
  DIOMEDES.

ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS

  CRESSIDA.

ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I'll tell you what-
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Fo, fo! come, tell a pin; you are a forsworn-
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. In faith, I cannot. What would you have me do?
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. A juggling trick, to be secretly open.
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. What did you swear you would bestow on me?
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I prithee, do not hold me to mine oath;
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Good night.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hold, patience!
  ULYSSES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. How now, Troyan!
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Diomed!
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. No, no, good night; I'll be your fool no more.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Thy better must.
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Hark! a word in your ear.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. O plague and madness!
  ULYSSES.

ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. You are moved, Prince; let us depart, I pray,
  TROILUS.

ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Behold, I pray you.

ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  TROILUS.

ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. I prithee stay.
  ULYSSES. 
12

ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. You have not patience; come.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. I pray you, stay; by hell and all hell's torments,
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. And so, good night.
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Nay, but you part in anger.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Doth that grieve thee? O withered truth!
  ULYSSES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. How now, my lord?
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. By Jove, I will be patient.
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Guardian! Why, Greek!
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Fo, fo! adieu! you palter.
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. In faith, I do not. Come hither once again.
  ULYSSES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. You shake, my lord, at something; will you go?
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. She strokes his cheek.
  ULYSSES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Come, come.
  TROILUS.

PARIS

PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Nay, stay; by Jove, I will not speak a word:
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. How the devil luxury, with his fat rump and potato
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. But will you, then?
  CRESSIDA. 
12

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. In faith, I will, lo; never trust me else.
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Give me some token for the surety of it.
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I'll fetch you one.                                  Exit
  ULYSSES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. You have sworn patience.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Fear me not, my lord;
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Fear me not, my lord;
    I will not be myself, nor have cognition
    Of what I feel. I am all patience.
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Now the pledge; now, now, now!
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Here, Diomed, keep this sleeve.
  TROILUS.

HECTOR

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. O beauty! where is thy faith?

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. I will be patient; outwardly I will.

HECTOR

CASSANDRA

CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Whose was't?

DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. It is no matter, now I ha't again.
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Now she sharpens. Well said, whetstone.
  DIOMEDES.

CRESSIDA

  DIOMEDES.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O all you gods! O pretty, pretty pledge!
  DIOMEDES.

ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. I had your heart before; this follows it.
  TROILUS. 
12

PARIS

TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. I did swear patience.
  CRESSIDA.

PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. You shall not have it, Diomed; faith, you shall not;
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. I will have this. Whose was it?
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. It is no matter.
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Come, tell me whose it was.
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. 'Twas one's that lov'd me better than you will.
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Whose was it?
  CRESSIDA. 
12

ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. By all Diana's waiting women yond,
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. To-morrow will I wear it on my helm,
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Wert thou the devil and wor'st it on thy horn,
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Well, well, 'tis done, 'tis past; and yet it is not;
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Why, then farewell;
  CRESSIDA. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. You shall not go. One cannot speak a word
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. I do not like this fooling.
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Nor I, by Pluto; but that that likes not you
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. What, shall I come? The hour-
  CRESSIDA.

TROILUS

CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Ay, come-O Jove! Do come. I shall be plagu'd.
  DIOMEDES.

  THERSITES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Would I could meet that rogue Diomed! I would croak like
  THERSITES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Would I could meet that rogue Diomed! I would croak like
    a raven; I would bode, I would bode. Patroclus will give me
    anything for the intelligence of this whore; the parrot will not
    do more for an almond than he for a commodious drab. Lechery,
    lechery! Still wars and lechery! Nothing else holds fashion. A
    burning devil take them!                                     Exit
  ANDROMACHE. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES

  HECTOR.

CASSANDRA
CTOR. Hold you still, I say.
    Mine honour keeps the weather of my fate.
    Life every man holds dear; but the dear man
    Holds honour far more precious dear than life.
  ANDROMACHE. 
11

  HECTOR.

10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Who should withhold me?
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Who should withhold me?
    Not fate, obedience, nor the hand of Mars
    Beck'ning with fiery truncheon my retire;
    Not Priamus and Hecuba on knees,
    Their eyes o'ergalled with recourse of tears;
    Nor you, my brother, with your true sword drawn,
    Oppos'd to hinder me, should stop my way,
    But by my ruin.
  CASSANDRA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. Lay hold upon him, Priam, hold him fast;
  PRIAM. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IAM. Come, Hector, come, go back.
  HECTOR.

ACHILLES

  CASSANDRA.

  PRIAM.

                           Exeunt severally PRIAM and HECTOR. Alarums
  TROILUS. 
10

  TROILUS.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. They are at it, hark! Proud Diomed, believe,
    I come to lose my arm or win my sleeve.
  PANDARUS. 
10

ULYSSES

  TROILUS.

  PANDARUS.

  TROILUS.

  PANDARUS. 
10

PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. A whoreson tisick, a whoreson rascally tisick so troubles
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Words, words, mere words, no matter from the heart;
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Words, words, mere words, no matter from the heart;
    Th' effect doth operate another way.
                                                 [Tearing the letter]
    Go, wind, to wind, there turn and change together.
    My love with words and errors still she feeds,
    But edifies another with her deeds.              Exeunt severally
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Now they are clapper-clawing one another; I'll go look
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Now they are clapper-clawing one another; I'll go look
    on. That dissembling abominable varlet, Diomed, has got that same
    scurvy doting foolish young knave's sleeve of Troy there in his
    helm. I would fain see them meet, that that same young Troyan ass
    that loves the whore there might send that Greekish whoremasterly
    villain with the sleeve back to the dissembling luxurious drab of
    a sleeve-less errand. A th' t'other side, the policy of those
    crafty swearing rascals-that stale old mouse-eaten dry cheese,
    Nestor, and that same dog-fox, Ulysses -is not prov'd worth a
    blackberry. They set me up, in policy, that mongrel cur, Ajax,
    against that dog of as bad a kind, Achilles; and now is the cur,
    Ajax prouder than the cur Achilles, and will not arm to-day;
    whereupon the Grecians begin to proclaim barbarism, and policy
    grows into an ill opinion.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Fly not; for shouldst thou take the river Styx
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Thou dost miscall retire.
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Hold thy whore, Grecian; now for thy whore,
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Hold thy whore, Grecian; now for thy whore,
    Troyan-now the sleeve, now the sleeve!
                                 Exeunt TROILUS and DIOMEDES fighting
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. What art thou, Greek? Art thou for Hector's match?
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. No, no-I am a rascal; a scurvy railing knave; a very
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I do believe thee. Live.                               Exit
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. God-a-mercy, that thou wilt believe me; but a plague
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. God-a-mercy, that thou wilt believe me; but a plague
    break thy neck for frighting me! What's become of the wenching
    rogues? I think they have swallowed one another. I would laugh at
    that miracle. Yet, in a sort, lechery eats itself. I'll seek
    them.                                                        Exit
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Go, go, my servant, take thou Troilus' horse;
  SERVANT. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RVANT. I go, my lord.                                        Exit
  AGAMEMNON. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Renew, renew! The fierce Polydamus
  AGAMEMNON. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Renew, renew! The fierce Polydamus
    Hath beat down enon; bastard Margarelon
    Hath Doreus prisoner,
    And stands colossus-wise, waving his beam,
    Upon the pashed corses of the kings
    Epistrophus and Cedius. Polixenes is slain;
    Amphimacus and Thoas deadly hurt;
    Patroclus ta'en, or slain; and Palamedes
    Sore hurt and bruis'd. The dreadful Sagittary
    Appals our numbers. Haste we, Diomed,
    To reinforcement, or we perish all.
  NESTOR. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Go, bear Patroclus' body to Achilles,
  NESTOR. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Go, bear Patroclus' body to Achilles,
    And bid the snail-pac'd Ajax arm for shame.
    There is a thousand Hectors in the field;
    Now here he fights on Galathe his horse,
    And there lacks work; anon he's there afoot,
    And there they fly or die, like scaled sculls
    Before the belching whale; then is he yonder,
    And there the strawy Greeks, ripe for his edge,
    Fall down before him like the mower's swath.
    Here, there, and everywhere, he leaves and takes;
    Dexterity so obeying appetite
    That what he will he does, and does so much
    That proof is call'd impossibility.
  ULYSSES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O, courage, courage, courage, Princes! Great
  ULYSSES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O, courage, courage, courage, Princes! Great
    Achilles Is arming, weeping, cursing, vowing vengeance.
    Patroclus' wounds have rous'd his drowsy blood,
    Together with his mangled Myrmidons,
    That noseless, handless, hack'd and chipp'd, come to
    him, Crying on Hector. Ajax hath lost a friend
    And foams at mouth, and he is arm'd and at it,
    Roaring for Troilus; who hath done to-day
    Mad and fantastic execution,
    Engaging and redeeming of himself
    With such a careless force and forceless care
    As if that luck, in very spite of cunning,
    Bade him win all.
  AJAX. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Troilus! thou coward Troilus!                            Exit
  DIOMEDES.

  ACHILLES.

  ACHILLES. 
13
AENEAS

ULYSSES
PARIS

DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Where is this Hector?
    Come, come, thou boy-queller, show thy face;
    Know what it is to meet Achilles angry.
    Hector! where's Hector? I will none but Hector.            Exeunt
  AJAX. 
13

    Ere that correction. Troilus, I say! What, Troilus!
  TROILUS.

CTOR. Fare thee well.
    I would have been much more a fresher man,
    Had I expected thee.
  TROILUS.

  HECTOR.

  HECTOR. 
14
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Stand, stand, thou Greek; thou art a goodly mark.
    No? wilt thou not? I like thy armour well;
    I'll frush it and unlock the rivets all
    But I'll be master of it. Wilt thou not, beast, abide?
    Why then, fly on; I'll hunt thee for thy hide.             Exeunt
  ACHILLES. 
14
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Come here about me, you my Myrmidons;
  ACHILLES. 
15
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Come here about me, you my Myrmidons;
    Mark what I say. Attend me where I wheel;
    Strike not a stroke, but keep yourselves in breath;
    And when I have the bloody Hector found,
    Empale him with your weapons round about;
    In fellest manner execute your arms.
    Follow me, sirs, and my proceedings eye.
    It is decreed Hector the great must die.                   Exeunt
  THERSITES. 
15
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. The cuckold and the cuckold-maker are at it. Now, bull!
  THERSITES. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. The cuckold and the cuckold-maker are at it. Now, bull!
    now, dog! 'Loo, Paris, 'loo! now my double-horn'd Spartan! 'loo,
    Paris, 'loo! The bull has the game. Ware horns, ho!
                                            Exeunt PARIS and MENELAUS
  MARGARELON.

  HECTOR.

TROILUS

THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Most putrified core so fair without,
    Thy goodly armour thus hath cost thy life.
    Now is my day's work done; I'll take good breath:
    Rest, sword; thou hast thy fill of blood and death!
  ACHILLES. 
15
MARGARELON

  HECTOR.

  ACHILLES. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. The dragon wing of night o'erspreads the earth
    And, stickler-like, the armies separates.
    My half-supp'd sword, that frankly would have fed,
    Pleas'd with this dainty bait, thus goes to bed.
                                                 [Sheathes his sword]
    Come, tie his body to my horse's tail;
    Along the field I will the Troyan trail.                   Exeunt
  AGAMEMNON. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES

TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  NESTOR.

  SOLDIERS.

15
MARGARELON
AENEAS

ULYSSES

CRESSIDA

AMEMNON. March patiently along. Let one be sent
  AGAMEMNON. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. March patiently along. Let one be sent
    To pray Achilles see us at our tent.
    If in his death the gods have us befriended;
    Great Troy is ours, and our sharp wars are ended.
    Exeunt
  AENEAS. 
15
MARGARELON

CRESSIDA

NEAS. Stand, ho! yet are we masters of the field.
  AENEAS. 
15

NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Stand, ho! yet are we masters of the field.
    Never go home; here starve we out the night.
  TROILUS. 
15
MARGARELON

  AENEAS.

  TROILUS. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. You understand me not that tell me so.
  TROILUS. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. You understand me not that tell me so.
    I do not speak of flight, of fear of death,
    But dare all imminence that gods and men
    Address their dangers in. Hector is gone.
    Who shall tell Priam so, or Hecuba?
    Let him that will a screech-owl aye be call'd
    Go in to Troy, and say there 'Hector's dead.'
    There is a word will Priam turn to stone;
    Make wells and Niobes of the maids and wives,
    Cold statues of the youth; and, in a word,
    Scare Troy out of itself. But, march away;
    Hector is dead; there is no more to say.
    Stay yet. You vile abominable tents,
    Thus proudly pight upon our Phrygian plains,
    Let Titan rise as early as he dare,
    I'll through and through you. And, thou great-siz'd coward,
    No space of earth shall sunder our two hates;
    I'll haunt thee like a wicked conscience still,
    That mouldeth goblins swift as frenzy's thoughts.
    Strike a free march to Troy. With comfort go;
    Hope of revenge shall hide our inward woe.
  PANDARUS. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS

CASSANDRA
NDARUS. But hear you, hear you!
  TROILUS.

    Pursue thy life and live aye with thy name!

  CRESSIDA, 
1
TROILUS
ESSIDA, daughter to Calchas
                          SCENE:
             Troy and the Greek camp before it
                  TROILUS AND CRESSIDA
                        PROLOGUE
    In Troy, there lies the scene. From isles of Greece
    The princes orgillous, their high blood chaf'd,
    Have to the port of Athens sent their ships
    Fraught with the ministers and instruments
    Of cruel war. Sixty and nine that wore
    Their crownets regal from th' Athenian bay
    Put forth toward Phrygia; and their vow is made
    To ransack Troy, within whose strong immures
    The ravish'd Helen, Menelaus' queen,
    With wanton Paris sleeps-and that's the quarrel.
    To Tenedos they come,
    And the deep-drawing barks do there disgorge
    Their war-like fraughtage. Now on Dardan plains
    The fresh and yet unbruised Greeks do pitch
    Their brave pavilions: Priam's six-gated city,
    Dardan, and Tymbria, Helias, Chetas, Troien,
    And Antenorides, with massy staples
    And corresponsive and fulfilling bolts,
    Sperr up the sons of Troy.
    Now expectation, tickling skittish spirits
    On one and other side, Troyan and Greek,
    Sets all on hazard-and hither am I come
    A Prologue arm'd, but not in confidence
    Of author's pen or actor's voice, but suited
    In like conditions as our argument,
    To tell you, fair beholders, that our play
    Leaps o'er the vaunt and firstlings of those broils,
    Beginning in the middle; starting thence away,
    To what may be digested in a play.
    Like or find fault; do as your pleasures are;
    Now good or bad, 'tis but the chance of war.
  TROILUS. 
1
TROILUS
OILUS. Call here my varlet; I'll unarm again.
  PANDARUS. 
1
TROILUS
NDARUS. Will this gear ne'er be mended?

TROILUS
OILUS. Peace, you ungracious clamours! Peace, rude sounds!
  TROILUS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
OILUS. Peace, you ungracious clamours! Peace, rude sounds!
    Fools on both sides! Helen must needs be fair,
    When with your blood you daily paint her thus.
    I cannot fight upon this argument;
    It is too starv'd a subject for my sword.
    But Pandarus-O gods, how do you plague me!
    I cannot come to Cressid but by Pandar;
    And he's as tetchy to be woo'd to woo
    As she is stubborn-chaste against all suit.
    Tell me, Apollo, for thy Daphne's love,
    What Cressid is, what Pandar, and what we?
    Her bed is India; there she lies, a pearl;
    Between our Ilium and where she resides
    Let it be call'd the wild and wand'ring flood;
    Ourself the merchant, and this sailing Pandar
    Our doubtful hope, our convoy, and our bark.
  AENEAS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
NEAS. How now, Prince Troilus! Wherefore not afield?
  TROILUS. 
2
TROILUS
AENEAS
OILUS. Because not there. This woman's answer sorts,
  AENEAS.

AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. That's Aeneas. Is not that a brave man? He's one of the
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Who's that?
  PANDARUS. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. That's Antenor. He has a shrewd wit, I can tell you; and
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Will he give you the nod?
  PANDARUS. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. You shall see.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. If he do, the rich shall have more.
  PANDARUS. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. That's Hector, that, that, look you, that; there's a
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. O, a brave man!
  PANDARUS. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. Is 'a not? It does a man's heart good. Look you what
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Be those with swords?
  PANDARUS. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. Swords! anything, he cares not; an the devil come to him,
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Who's that?
  PANDARUS. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. That's Helenus. I marvel where Troilus is. That's
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Can Helenus fight, uncle?
  PANDARUS. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. Helenus! no. Yes, he'll fight indifferent well. I marvel
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. What sneaking fellow comes yonder?
  PANDARUS. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. Where? yonder? That's Deiphobus. 'Tis Troilus. There's a
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Peace, for shame, peace!
  PANDARUS. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. Mark him; note him. O brave Troilus! Look well upon him,
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Here comes more.
  PANDARUS. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. Asses, fools, dolts! chaff and bran, chaff and bran!
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA

  PANDARUS. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. Achilles? A drayman, a porter, a very camel!
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Well, well.
  PANDARUS. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. Well, well! Why, have you any discretion? Have you any
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Ay, a minc'd man; and then to be bak'd with no date in
  PANDARUS. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. You are such a woman! A man knows not at what ward you
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA

  PANDARUS. 
4

AENEAS

  CRESSIDA. 
4

AENEAS
CRESSIDA

  PANDARUS. 
4

PANDARUS
AENEAS

NDARUS. You are such another!
  BOY. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
Y. Sir, my lord would instantly speak with you.
  PANDARUS. 
4

PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. Where?
  BOY. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
Y. At your own house; there he unarms him.
  PANDARUS. 
4

PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
NDARUS. Good boy, tell him I come.                       Exit Boy
  CRESSIDA. 
4

  PANDARUS.

  CRESSIDA. 
4

CRESSIDA

  PANDARUS. 
4

NDARUS. Ay, a token from Troilus.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
PANDARUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA

  CRESSIDA. 
3
TROILUS
AENEAS
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. By the same token, you are a bawd.
                                                        Exit PANDARUS
  CRESSIDA. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. By the same token, you are a bawd.
                                                        Exit PANDARUS
    Words, vows, gifts, tears, and love's full sacrifice,
    He offers in another's enterprise;
    But more in Troilus thousand-fold I see
    Than in the glass of Pandar's praise may be,
    Yet hold I off. Women are angels, wooing:
    Things won are done; joy's soul lies in the doing.
    That she belov'd knows nought that knows not this:
    Men prize the thing ungain'd more than it is.
    That she was never yet that ever knew
    Love got so sweet as when desire did sue;
    Therefore this maxim out of love I teach:
    Achievement is command; ungain'd, beseech.
    Then though my heart's content firm love doth bear,
    Nothing of that shall from mine eyes appear.                 Exit
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
AMEMNON. Princes,
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. With due observance of thy godlike seat,
  ULYSSES. 
4

AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. Agamemnon,
  AGAMEMNON.

AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

  ULYSSES.

AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

AENEAS
AGAMEMNON

  ULYSSES.

AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. The great Achilles, whom opinion crowns

  ULYSSES.

  NESTOR.

  AGAMEMNON.

  AGAMEMNON.

AGAMEMNON

4

  AGAMEMNON. 
4

AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

  AENEAS. 
4

AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

  AGAMEMNON. 
4

AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

  AENEAS.

  AGAMEMNON.

  AENEAS.

AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

  AGAMEMNON. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
AMEMNON. Fair Lord Aeneas, let me touch your hand;
    To our pavilion shall I lead you, first.
    Achilles shall have word of this intent;
    So shall each lord of Greece, from tent to tent.
    Yourself shall feast with us before you go,
    And find the welcome of a noble foe.
                                    Exeunt all but ULYSSES and NESTOR
  ULYSSES. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. Nestor!
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. What says Ulysses?
  ULYSSES. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. I have a young conception in my brain;
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. What is't?
  ULYSSES. 
4
TROILUS

AGAMEMNON

  NESTOR.

  ULYSSES. 
4

AGAMEMNON

  NESTOR. 
4

  ULYSSES.

  ULYSSES.

4

AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA

  ULYSSES. 
4

AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
YSSES. What glory our Achilles shares from Hector,
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. Now, Ulysses, I begin to relish thy advice;
  NESTOR. 
4
TROILUS
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
CRESSIDA
STOR. Now, Ulysses, I begin to relish thy advice;
    And I will give a taste thereof forthwith
    To Agamemnon. Go we to him straight.
    Two curs shall tame each other: pride alone
    Must tarre the mastiffs on, as 'twere their bone.          Exeunt
  AJAX.

  THERSITES.

  THERSITES.

AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. 'Tis no matter; I shall speak as much as thou
  PATROCLUS. 
5

AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA

  THERSITES. 
5

AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA

  ACHILLES.

AGAMEMNON

TROILUS
CRESSIDA

  THERSITES.

ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA

  PATROCLUS. 
5

AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA

  ACHILLES. 
5

AGAMEMNON
ACHILLES
TROILUS
CRESSIDA

  AJAX.

ACHILLES
TROILUS

  ACHILLES.

  AJAX.

  PRIAM.

  HECTOR.

  TROILUS.

  CASSANDRA.

  HECTOR. 
8
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I am yours,
    You valiant offspring of great Priamus.
    I have a roisting challenge sent amongst
    The dull and factious nobles of the Greeks
    Will strike amazement to their drowsy spirits.
    I was advertis'd their great general slept,
    Whilst emulation in the army crept.
    This, I presume, will wake him.                            Exeunt
  THERSITES. 
8
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. How now, Thersites! What, lost in the labyrinth of thy
  THERSITES. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. How now, Thersites! What, lost in the labyrinth of thy
    fury? Shall the elephant Ajax carry it thus? He beats me, and I
    rail at him. O worthy satisfaction! Would it were otherwise: that
    I could beat him, whilst he rail'd at me! 'Sfoot, I'll learn to
    conjure and raise devils, but I'll see some issue of my spiteful
    execrations. Then there's Achilles, a rare engineer! If Troy be
    not taken till these two undermine it, the walls will stand till
    they fall of themselves. O thou great thunder-darter of Olympus,
    forget that thou art Jove, the king of gods, and, Mercury, lose
    all the serpentine craft of thy caduceus, if ye take not that
    little little less-than-little wit from them that they have!
    which short-arm'd ignorance itself knows is so abundant scarce,
    it will not in circumvention deliver a fly from a spider without
    drawing their massy irons and cutting the web. After this, the
    vengeance on the whole camp! or, rather, the Neapolitan
    bone-ache! for that, methinks, is the curse depending on those
    that war for a placket. I have said my prayers; and devil Envy
    say 'Amen.' What ho! my Lord Achilles!
  PATROCLUS. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. Who's there? Thersites! Good Thersites, come in and
  THERSITES. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. If I could 'a rememb'red a gilt counterfeit, thou
  PATROCLUS.

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Here is such patchery, such juggling, and such knavery.
  THERSITES. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Here is such patchery, such juggling, and such knavery.
    All the argument is a whore and a cuckold-a good quarrel to draw
    emulous factions and bleed to death upon. Now the dry serpigo on
    the subject, and war and lechery confound all!               Exit
  AGAMEMNON. 
9
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
PATROCLUS
PRIAM

  AJAX.

  AGAMEMNON.

  AGAMEMNON. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Your mind is the clearer, Ajax, and your virtues the
    fairer. He that is proud eats up himself. Pride is his own glass,
    his own trumpet, his own chronicle; and whatever praises itself
    but in the deed devours the deed in the praise.
  AJAX. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. I do hate a proud man as I do hate the engend'ring of toads.
  NESTOR.

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. A paltry, insolent fellow!
  NESTOR. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. [Aside] How he describes himself!
  AJAX. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Can he not be sociable?
  ULYSSES. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. [Aside] The raven chides blackness.
  AJAX. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. I'll let his humours blood.
  AGAMEMNON. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. [Aside] He will be the physician that should be the
  AJAX. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. An all men were a my mind-
  ULYSSES. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. [Aside] Wit would be out of fashion.
  AJAX. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. 'A should not bear it so, 'a should eat's words first.
  NESTOR. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. [Aside] An 'twould, you'd carry half.
  ULYSSES. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. [Aside] 'A would have ten shares.
  AJAX. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. I will knead him, I'll make him supple.
  NESTOR. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. [Aside] He's not yet through warm. Force him with praises;
  ULYSSES. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. [To AGAMEMNON] My lord, you feed too much on this dislike.
  NESTOR. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Our noble general, do not do so.
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. You must prepare to fight without Achilles.
  ULYSSES. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Why 'tis this naming of him does him harm.
  NESTOR. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Wherefore should you so?
  ULYSSES. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Know the whole world, he is as valiant.
  AJAX. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. A whoreson dog, that shall palter with us thus!
  NESTOR. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. What a vice were it in Ajax now-
  ULYSSES. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. If he were proud.
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Or covetous of praise.
  ULYSSES.

AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Ay, or surly borne.
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Or strange, or self-affected.
  ULYSSES.

AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Thank the heavens, lord, thou art of sweet composure
  AJAX.

CASSANDRA
AX. Shall I call you father?

PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Ay, my good son.
  DIOMEDES.

PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Be rul'd by him, Lord Ajax.
  ULYSSES.

ULYSSES

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. There is no tarrying here; the hart Achilles
  AGAMEMNON. 
10
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Go we to council. Let Achilles sleep.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Go we to council. Let Achilles sleep.
    Light boats sail swift, though greater hulks draw deep.
    Exeunt
  PANDARUS. 
11
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Friend, you-pray you, a word. Do you not follow the young
  SERVANT. 
11
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RVANT. Ay, sir, when he goes before me.
  PANDARUS. 
11
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. You depend upon him, I mean?
  SERVANT. 
11
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RVANT. Sir, I do depend upon the lord.
  PANDARUS. 
11
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. You depend upon a notable gentleman; I must needs praise
  SERVANT. 
11

AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RVANT. The lord be praised!
  PANDARUS.

AGAMEMNON

PATROCLUS

THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. You know me, do you not?

PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Friend, know me better: I am the Lord Pandarus.
  SERVANT.

PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
PRIAM

TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

PRIAM

CRESSIDA

AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RVANT. You are in the state of grace.
  PANDARUS. 
11
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Grace! Not so, friend; honour and lordship are my titles.
  SERVANT. 
11
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RVANT. I do but partly know, sir; it is music in parts.
  PANDARUS.

AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  SERVANT.

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Who play they to?
  SERVANT.

PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA

PARIS

PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. Well, I'll make's excuse.
  PANDARUS. 
12

ULYSSES

PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Ay, good my lord. Why should you say Cressida?
  PARIS.

PRIAM

PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. You spy! What do you spy?-Come, give me an instrument.
  HELEN.

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
LEN. Why, this is kindly done.
  PANDARUS. 
12
AENEAS

PARIS

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. My niece is horribly in love with a thing you have, sweet
  HELEN. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
LEN. She shall have it, my lord, if it be not my Lord Paris.
  PANDARUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. He! No, she'll none of him; they two are twain.
  HELEN. 
12
AENEAS

CASSANDRA
LEN. Falling in, after falling out, may make them three.
  PANDARUS.

  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. I am giddy; expectation whirls me round.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. I am giddy; expectation whirls me round.
    Th' imaginary relish is so sweet
    That it enchants my sense; what will it be
    When that the wat'ry palate tastes indeed
    Love's thrice-repured nectar? Death, I fear me;
    Swooning destruction; or some joy too fine,
    Too subtle-potent, tun'd too sharp in sweetness,
    For the capacity of my ruder powers.
    I fear it much; and I do fear besides
    That I shall lose distinction in my joys;
    As doth a battle, when they charge on heaps
    The enemy flying.
  PANDARUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. She's making her ready, she'll come straight; you must be
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Even such a passion doth embrace my bosom.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Even such a passion doth embrace my bosom.
    My heart beats thicker than a feverous pulse,
    And all my powers do their bestowing lose,
    Like vassalage at unawares encount'ring
    The eye of majesty.
  PANDARUS. 
12
AENEAS

  TROILUS.

12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Amen. Whereupon I will show you a chamber
    and a bed; which bed, because it shall not speak of your
    pretty encounters, press it to death. Away!
    And Cupid grant all tongue-tied maidens here,
    Bed, chamber, pander, to provide this gear!                Exeunt
  CALCHAS. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
LCHAS. Now, Princes, for the service I have done,
  AGAMEMNON. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. What wouldst thou of us, Troyan? Make demand.
  CALCHAS. 
12

  DIOMEDES.

PRIAM

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. This shall I undertake; and 'tis a burden
    Which I am proud to bear.
                                          Exeunt DIOMEDES and CALCHAS
  ULYSSES.

  AGAMEMNON. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. We'll execute your purpose, and put on
  ACHILLES. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. What comes the general to speak with me?
  AGAMEMNON. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. What says Achilles? Would he aught with us?
  NESTOR. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Would you, my lord, aught with the general?
  ACHILLES. 
12
AENEAS

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. No.
  NESTOR.

PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  AGAMEMNON.

  AGAMEMNON.

  ACHILLES.

  ACHILLES.

  AJAX.

  ACHILLES.

  ACHILLES.

  ACHILLES.

CRESSIDA

HILLES. I do believe it; for they pass'd by me
  ULYSSES.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  ACHILLES.

  ULYSSES.

PRIAM

THERSITES
CRESSIDA

  ACHILLES.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. I see my reputation is at stake;
  PATROCLUS. 
11

PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. O, then, beware:
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Go call Thersites hither, sweet Patroclus.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Go call Thersites hither, sweet Patroclus.
    I'll send the fool to Ajax, and desire him
    T' invite the Troyan lords, after the combat,
    To see us here unarm'd. I have a woman's longing,
    An appetite that I am sick withal,
    To see great Hector in his weeds of peace;
    To talk with him, and to behold his visage,
    Even to my full of view.
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. A wonder!
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. What?
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Ajax goes up and down the field asking for himself.
  ACHILLES. 
11

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM

TROILUS

  THERSITES.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. He must fight singly to-morrow with Hector, and is so
  ACHILLES.

PARIS

TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. How can that be?
  THERSITES.

  ACHILLES.

  ACHILLES.

PARIS

PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Why, but he is not in this tune, is he?
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. No, but he's out a tune thus. What music will be in him
  ACHILLES. 
11
