ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Come, thou shalt bear a letter to him straight.
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Let me carry another to his horse; for that's the more
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
ACHILLES
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. My mind is troubled, like a fountain stirr'd;
  ACHILLES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. My mind is troubled, like a fountain stirr'd;
    And I myself see not the bottom of it.
                                        Exeunt ACHILLES and PATROCLUS
  THERSITES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Would the fountain of your mind were clear again, that I
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. See, ho! Who is that there?
  DEIPHOBUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IPHOBUS. It is the Lord Aeneas.
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Is the Prince there in person?
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. That's my mind too. Good morrow, Lord Aeneas.
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. A valiant Greek, Aeneas -take his hand:
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Health to you, valiant sir,
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. The one and other Diomed embraces.
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. And thou shalt hunt a lion, that will fly
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. We sympathise. Jove let Aeneas live,
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. We know each other well.
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. This is the most despiteful'st gentle greeting
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. I was sent for to the King; but why, I know not.
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. His purpose meets you: 'twas to bring this Greek
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. That I assure you:
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. There is no help;
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Good morrow, all.                         Exit with servant
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. And tell me, noble Diomed-faith, tell me true,
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Both alike:
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. You are too bitter to your country-woman.
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. She's bitter to her country. Hear me, Paris:
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. Fair Diomed, you do as chapmen do,
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. Fair Diomed, you do as chapmen do,
    Dispraise the thing that you desire to buy;
    But we in silence hold this virtue well:
    We'll not commend what we intend to sell.
    Here lies our way.                                         Exeunt
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Dear, trouble not yourself; the morn is cold.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Then, sweet my lord, I'll call mine uncle down;
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Trouble him not;
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Good morrow, then.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. I prithee now, to bed.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Are you aweary of me?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. O Cressida! but that the busy day,
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Night hath been too brief.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Beshrew the witch! with venomous wights she stays
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Prithee tarry.
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. [Within] What's all the doors open here?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. It is your uncle.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. A pestilence on him! Now will he be mocking.
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. How now, how now! How go maidenheads?
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Go hang yourself, you naughty mocking uncle.
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. To do what? to do what? Let her say what.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Come, come, beshrew your heart! You'll ne'er be good,
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Ha, ha! Alas, poor wretch! a poor capocchia! hast not
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Did not I tell you? Would he were knock'd i' th' head!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Ha! ha!
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Come, you are deceiv'd, I think of no such thing.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Come, you are deceiv'd, I think of no such thing.
    How earnestly they knock! Pray you come in:
    I would not for half Troy have you seen here.
                                          Exeunt TROILUS and CRESSIDA
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Who's there? What's the matter? Will you beat down the
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Who's there? What's the matter? Will you beat down the
    door? How now? What's the matter?
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Good morrow, lord, good morrow.
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Who's there? My lord Aeneas? By my troth,
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Is not Prince Troilus here?
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Here! What should he do here?
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Come, he is here, my lord; do not deny him.
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Is he here, say you? It's more than I know, I'll be
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Who!-nay, then. Come, come, you'll do him wrong ere you are
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Who!-nay, then. Come, come, you'll do him wrong ere you are
    ware; you'll be so true to him to be false to him. Do not you
    know of him, but yet go fetch him hither; go.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. How now! What's the matter?
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. My lord, I scarce have leisure to salute you,
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Is it so concluded?
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. By Priam, and the general state of Troy.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. How my achievements mock me!
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Good, good, my lord, the secrets of neighbour Pandar
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Good, good, my lord, the secrets of neighbour Pandar
    Have not more gift in taciturnity.
                                            Exeunt TROILUS and AENEAS
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Is't possible? No sooner got but lost? The devil take
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Is't possible? No sooner got but lost? The devil take
    Antenor! The young prince will go mad. A plague upon Antenor! I
    would they had broke's neck.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. How now! What's the matter? Who was here?
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Ah, ah!
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why sigh you so profoundly? Where's my lord? Gone? Tell
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Would I were as deep under the earth as I am above!
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O the gods! What's the matter?
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Pray thee, get thee in. Would thou hadst ne'er been born!
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Good uncle, I beseech you, on my knees I beseech you,
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Thou must be gone, wench, thou must be gone; thou art
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O you immortal gods! I will not go.
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Thou must.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I will not, uncle. I have forgot my father;
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Do, do.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Tear my bright hair, and scratch my praised cheeks,
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Tear my bright hair, and scratch my praised cheeks,
    Crack my clear voice with sobs and break my heart,
    With sounding 'Troilus.' I will not go from Troy.
    Exeunt
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. It is great morning; and the hour prefix'd
  TROILUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Walk into her house.
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. I know what 'tis to love,
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. I know what 'tis to love,
    And would, as I shall pity, I could help!
    Please you walk in, my lords.                              Exeunt
  PANDARUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Be moderate, be moderate.
  CRESSIDA. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why tell you me of moderation?
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why tell you me of moderation?
    The grief is fine, full, perfect, that I taste,
    And violenteth in a sense as strong
    As that which causeth it. How can I moderate it?
    If I could temporize with my affections
    Or brew it to a weak and colder palate,
    The like allayment could I give my grief.
    My love admits no qualifying dross;
    No more my grief, in such a precious loss.
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Here, here, here he comes. Ah, sweet ducks!
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O Troilus! Troilus! [Embracing him]
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. What a pair of spectacles is here! Let me embrace too. 'O
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Cressid, I love thee in so strain'd a purity
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Have the gods envy?
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Ay, ay, ay; 'tis too plain a case.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. And is it true that I must go from Troy?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. A hateful truth.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. What, and from Troilus too?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. From Troy and Troilus.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Is't possible?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. And suddenly; where injury of chance
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. [Within] My lord, is the lady ready?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hark! you are call'd. Some say the Genius so
  PANDARUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Where are my tears? Rain, to lay this wind, or my heart
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I must then to the Grecians?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. No remedy.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. A woeful Cressid 'mongst the merry Greeks!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hear me, my love. Be thou but true of heart-
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I true! how now! What wicked deem is this?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Nay, we must use expostulation kindly,
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O, you shall be expos'd, my lord, to dangers
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. And I'll grow friend with danger. Wear this sleeve.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. And you this glove. When shall I see you?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. I will corrupt the Grecian sentinels
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O heavens! 'Be true' again!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hear why I speak it, love.
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. O heavens! you love me not.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Die I a villain, then!
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Do you think I will?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. No.
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. [Within] Nay, good my lord!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Come, kiss; and let us part.
  PARIS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. [Within] Brother Troilus!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Good brother, come you hither;
  CRESSIDA. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. My lord, will you be true?
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Who, I? Alas, it is my vice, my fault!
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Who, I? Alas, it is my vice, my fault!
    Whiles others fish with craft for great opinion,
    I with great truth catch mere simplicity;
    Whilst some with cunning gild their copper crowns,
    With truth and plainness I do wear mine bare.
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Fair Lady Cressid,
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Grecian, thou dost not use me courteously
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. O, be not mov'd, Prince Troilus.
  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
TROILUS
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Come, to the port. I'll tell thee, Diomed,
  TROILUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Come, to the port. I'll tell thee, Diomed,
    This brave shall oft make thee to hide thy head.
    Lady, give me your hand; and, as we walk,
    To our own selves bend we our needful talk.
                               Exeunt TROILUS, CRESSIDA, and DIOMEDES
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. Hark! Hector's trumpet.
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. How have we spent this morning!
  PARIS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RIS. 'Tis Troilus' fault. Come, come to field with him.
  DEIPHOBUS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IPHOBUS. Let us make ready straight.
  AENEAS. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Yea, with a bridegroom's fresh alacrity
  AENEAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Yea, with a bridegroom's fresh alacrity
    Let us address to tend on Hector's heels.
    The glory of our Troy doth this day lie
    On his fair worth and single chivalry.                     Exeunt
  AGAMEMNON. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Here art thou in appointment fresh and fair,
  AJAX. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Thou, trumpet, there's my purse.
  ULYSSES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. No trumpet answers.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. 'Tis but early days.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Is not yond Diomed, with Calchas' daughter?
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. 'Tis he, I ken the manner of his gait:
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Is this the lady Cressid?
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Even she.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Most dearly welcome to the Greeks, sweet lady.
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Our general doth salute you with a kiss.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Yet is the kindness but particular;
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. And very courtly counsel: I'll begin.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. I'll take that winter from your lips, fair lady.
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. I had good argument for kissing once.
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. But that's no argument for kissing now;
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O deadly gall, and theme of all our scorns!
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. The first was Menelaus' kiss; this, mine-
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. O, this is trim!
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. Paris and I kiss evermore for him.
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. I'll have my kiss, sir. Lady, by your leave.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. In kissing, do you render or receive?
  PATROCLUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
TROCLUS. Both take and give.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I'll make my match to live,
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. I'll give you boot; I'll give you three for one.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. You are an odd man; give even or give none.
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. An odd man, lady? Every man is odd.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. No, Paris is not; for you know 'tis true
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. You fillip me o' th' head.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. No, I'll be sworn.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. It were no match, your nail against his horn.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. You may.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. I do desire it.
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Why, beg then.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Why then, for Venus' sake give me a kiss
  CRESSIDA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. I am your debtor; claim it when 'tis due.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Never's my day, and then a kiss of you.
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Lady, a word. I'll bring you to your father.
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Lady, a word. I'll bring you to your father.
                                                   Exit with CRESSIDA
  NESTOR. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
STOR. A woman of quick sense.
  ULYSSES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Fie, fie upon her!
  ALL. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
L. The Troyans' trumpet.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Yonder comes the troop.
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Hail, all the state of Greece! What shall be done
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Which way would Hector have it?
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. He cares not; he'll obey conditions.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. 'Tis done like Hector; but securely done,
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. If not Achilles, sir,
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. If not Achilles, nothing.
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Therefore Achilles. But whate'er, know this:
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. A maiden battle then? O, I perceive you!
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Here is Sir Diomed. Go, gentle knight,
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. They are oppos'd already.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. What Troyan is that same that looks so heavy?
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. The youngest son of Priam, a true knight;
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. They are in action.
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
STOR. Now, Ajax, hold thine own!
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hector, thou sleep'st;
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. His blows are well dispos'd. There, Ajax!
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. You must no more.
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Princes, enough, so please you.
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AX. I am not warm yet; let us fight again.
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. As Hector pleases.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Why, then will I no more.
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AX. I thank thee, Hector.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Not Neoptolemus so mirable,
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. There is expectance here from both the sides
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. We'll answer it:
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AX. If I might in entreaties find success,
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. 'Tis Agamemnon's wish; and great Achilles
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Aeneas, call my brother Troilus to me,
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AX. Great Agamemnon comes to meet us here.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. The worthiest of them tell me name by name;
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I thank thee, most imperious Agamemnon.
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. [To Troilus] My well-fam'd lord of Troy, no less to you.
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. Let me confirm my princely brother's greeting.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Who must we answer?
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. The noble Menelaus.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. O you, my lord? By Mars his gauntlet, thanks!
  MENELAUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NELAUS. Name her not now, sir; she's a deadly theme.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. O, pardon; I offend.
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
STOR. I have, thou gallant Troyan, seen thee oft,
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
NEAS. 'Tis the old Nestor.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Let me embrace thee, good old chronicle,
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
STOR. I would my arms could match thee in contention
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I would they could.
  NESTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
STOR. Ha!
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. I wonder now how yonder city stands,
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I know your favour, Lord Ulysses, well.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Sir, I foretold you then what would ensue.
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I must not believe you.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
YSSES. So to him we leave it.
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. I shall forestall thee, Lord Ulysses, thou!
  HECTOR.

11
AENEAS

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. First, all you peers of Greece, go to my tent;
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. First, all you peers of Greece, go to my tent;
    There in the full convive we; afterwards,
    As Hector's leisure and your bounties shall
    Concur together, severally entreat him.
    Beat loud the tambourines, let the trumpets blow,
    That this great soldier may his welcome know.
                                   Exeunt all but TROILUS and ULYSSES
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
THERSITES
CASSANDRA

  ULYSSES.

  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
OILUS. O, sir, to such as boasting show their scars
    A mock is due. Will you walk on, my lord?
    She was belov'd, she lov'd; she is, and doth;
    But still sweet love is food for fortune's tooth.          Exeunt
  ACHILLES. 
12

THERSITES
CASSANDRA

  PATROCLUS.

  PATROCLUS.

  ACHILLES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite
  ACHILLES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
HILLES. My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite
    From my great purpose in to-morrow's battle.
    Here is a letter from Queen Hecuba,
    A token from her daughter, my fair love,
    Both taxing me and gaging me to keep
    An oath that I have sworn. I will not break it.
    Fall Greeks; fail fame; honour or go or stay;
    My major vow lies here, this I'll obey.
    Come, come, Thersites, help to trim my tent;
    This night in banqueting must all be spent.
    Away, Patroclus!                              Exit with PATROCLUS
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. With too much blood and too little brain these two may
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. With too much blood and too little brain these two may
    run mad; but, if with too much brain and to little blood they do,
    I'll be a curer of madmen. Here's Agamemnon, an honest fellow
    enough, and one that loves quails, but he has not so much brain
    as ear-wax; and the goodly transformation of Jupiter there, his
    brother, the bull, the primitive statue and oblique memorial of
    cuckolds, a thrifty shoeing-horn in a chain, hanging at his
    brother's leg-to what form but that he is, should wit larded with
    malice, and malice forced with wit, turn him to? To an ass, were
    nothing: he is both ass and ox. To an ox, were nothing: he is both
    ox and ass. To be a dog, a mule, a cat, a fitchew, a toad, a
    lizard, an owl, a put-tock, or a herring without a roe, I would
    not care; but to be Menelaus, I would conspire against destiny.
    Ask me not what I would be, if I were not Thersites; for I care
    not to be the louse of a lazar, so I were not Menelaus. Hey-day!
    sprites and fires!
  AGAMEMNON. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. We go wrong, we go wrong.
  AJAX. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CASSANDRA
AX. No, yonder 'tis;
  HECTOR.

  THERSITES. 
9
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. That same Diomed's a false-hearted rogue, a most unjust
  THERSITES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. That same Diomed's a false-hearted rogue, a most unjust
    knave; I will no more trust him when he leers than I will a
    serpent when he hisses. He will spend his mouth and promise, like
    Brabbler the hound; but when he performs, astronomers foretell
    it: it is prodigious, there will come some change; the sun
    borrows of the moon when Diomed keeps his word. I will rather
    leave to see Hector than not to dog him. They say he keeps a
    Troyan drab, and uses the traitor Calchas' tent. I'll after.
    Nothing but lechery! All incontinent varlets!                Exit
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. What, are you up here, ho? Speak.
  CALCHAS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
LCHAS. [Within] Who calls?
  DIOMEDES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Diomed. Calchas, I think. Where's your daughter?
  CALCHAS.

AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS

DIOMEDES
HECTOR

TROILUS

  DIOMEDES.

ACHILLES
CRESSIDA

  CRESSIDA.

AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Sweet honey Greek, tempt me no more to folly.
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Roguery!
  DIOMEDES.

CASSANDRA

  THERSITES.

HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. A juggling trick, to be secretly open.
  DIOMEDES.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  DIOMEDES.

CASSANDRA

  DIOMEDES.

ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  CRESSIDA.

HECTOR

ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Nay, but you part in anger.
  TROILUS.

PRIAM

HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Doth that grieve thee? O withered truth!
  ULYSSES.

HECTOR

ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. In faith, I do not. Come hither once again.
  ULYSSES.

CASSANDRA

  THERSITES.

  DIOMEDES.

  ULYSSES.

  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Fear me not, my lord;
    I will not be myself, nor have cognition
    Of what I feel. I am all patience.
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM

HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA

  CRESSIDA.

  DIOMEDES.

  CRESSIDA.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  DIOMEDES.

  CRESSIDA.

AJAX
TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  DIOMEDES.

  CRESSIDA.

  DIOMEDES.

  DIOMEDES.

CASSANDRA
OMEDES. What, shall I come? The hour-
  CRESSIDA. 
12

PRIAM
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Ay, come-O Jove! Do come. I shall be plagu'd.
  DIOMEDES.

ULYSSES
PARIS

DIOMEDES
HECTOR

ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Farewell till then.

CASSANDRA
ESSIDA. Good night. I prithee come.                 Exit DIOMEDES
  THERSITES.

AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. A proof of strength she could not publish more,
  ULYSSES.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  ULYSSES.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

  TROILUS.

CASSANDRA

PARIS

PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Most sure she was.
  TROILUS. 
11

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Why, my negation hath no taste of madness.
  ULYSSES. 
11

PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. Nor mine, my lord. Cressid was here but now.
  TROILUS. 
11

ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Let it not be believ'd for womanhood.
  ULYSSES. 
11

ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. What hath she done, Prince, that can soil our mothers?
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Nothing at all, unless that this were she.
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Will 'a swagger himself out on's own eyes?
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. This she? No; this is Diomed's Cressida.
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. May worthy Troilus be half-attach'd
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Ay, Greek; and that shall be divulged well
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. He'll tickle it for his concupy.
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. O Cressid! O false Cressid! false, false, false!
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O, contain yourself;
  ULYSSES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O, contain yourself;
    Your passion draws ears hither.
  AENEAS. 
11
AENEAS

PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. I have been seeking you this hour, my lord.
  TROILUS.

  THERSITES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Would I could meet that rogue Diomed! I would croak like
  THERSITES. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Would I could meet that rogue Diomed! I would croak like
    a raven; I would bode, I would bode. Patroclus will give me
    anything for the intelligence of this whore; the parrot will not
    do more for an almond than he for a commodious drab. Lechery,
    lechery! Still wars and lechery! Nothing else holds fashion. A
    burning devil take them!                                     Exit
  ANDROMACHE. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS

HECTOR
AJAX

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
DROMACHE. When was my lord so much ungently temper'd
  HECTOR.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. You train me to offend you; get you in.

TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Hold you still, I say.
    Mine honour keeps the weather of my fate.
    Life every man holds dear; but the dear man
    Holds honour far more precious dear than life.
  ANDROMACHE. 
11
AENEAS

  HECTOR.

10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Who should withhold me?
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Who should withhold me?
    Not fate, obedience, nor the hand of Mars
    Beck'ning with fiery truncheon my retire;
    Not Priamus and Hecuba on knees,
    Their eyes o'ergalled with recourse of tears;
    Nor you, my brother, with your true sword drawn,
    Oppos'd to hinder me, should stop my way,
    But by my ruin.
  CASSANDRA. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. Lay hold upon him, Priam, hold him fast;
  PRIAM. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
PRIAM
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IAM. Come, Hector, come, go back.

  TROILUS.

    I come to lose my arm or win my sleeve.
  PANDARUS.

  TROILUS. 
10
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS

CASSANDRA
OILUS. Words, words, mere words, no matter from the heart;
  TROILUS. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Words, words, mere words, no matter from the heart;
    Th' effect doth operate another way.
                                                 [Tearing the letter]
    Go, wind, to wind, there turn and change together.
    My love with words and errors still she feeds,
    But edifies another with her deeds.              Exeunt severally
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Now they are clapper-clawing one another; I'll go look
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Now they are clapper-clawing one another; I'll go look
    on. That dissembling abominable varlet, Diomed, has got that same
    scurvy doting foolish young knave's sleeve of Troy there in his
    helm. I would fain see them meet, that that same young Troyan ass
    that loves the whore there might send that Greekish whoremasterly
    villain with the sleeve back to the dissembling luxurious drab of
    a sleeve-less errand. A th' t'other side, the policy of those
    crafty swearing rascals-that stale old mouse-eaten dry cheese,
    Nestor, and that same dog-fox, Ulysses -is not prov'd worth a
    blackberry. They set me up, in policy, that mongrel cur, Ajax,
    against that dog of as bad a kind, Achilles; and now is the cur,
    Ajax prouder than the cur Achilles, and will not arm to-day;
    whereupon the Grecians begin to proclaim barbarism, and policy
    grows into an ill opinion.
  TROILUS. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Fly not; for shouldst thou take the river Styx
  DIOMEDES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Thou dost miscall retire.
  THERSITES. 
12
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Hold thy whore, Grecian; now for thy whore,
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Hold thy whore, Grecian; now for thy whore,
    Troyan-now the sleeve, now the sleeve!
                                 Exeunt TROILUS and DIOMEDES fighting
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. What art thou, Greek? Art thou for Hector's match?
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. No, no-I am a rascal; a scurvy railing knave; a very
  HECTOR. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I do believe thee. Live.                               Exit
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. God-a-mercy, that thou wilt believe me; but a plague
  THERSITES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. God-a-mercy, that thou wilt believe me; but a plague
    break thy neck for frighting me! What's become of the wenching
    rogues? I think they have swallowed one another. I would laugh at
    that miracle. Yet, in a sort, lechery eats itself. I'll seek
    them.                                                        Exit
  DIOMEDES. 
11
AENEAS
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Go, go, my servant, take thou Troilus' horse;
  SERVANT. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RVANT. I go, my lord.                                        Exit
  AGAMEMNON. 
12
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Renew, renew! The fierce Polydamus
  AGAMEMNON. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Renew, renew! The fierce Polydamus
    Hath beat down enon; bastard Margarelon
    Hath Doreus prisoner,
    And stands colossus-wise, waving his beam,
    Upon the pashed corses of the kings
    Epistrophus and Cedius. Polixenes is slain;
    Amphimacus and Thoas deadly hurt;
    Patroclus ta'en, or slain; and Palamedes
    Sore hurt and bruis'd. The dreadful Sagittary
    Appals our numbers. Haste we, Diomed,
    To reinforcement, or we perish all.
  NESTOR. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Go, bear Patroclus' body to Achilles,
  NESTOR. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Go, bear Patroclus' body to Achilles,
    And bid the snail-pac'd Ajax arm for shame.
    There is a thousand Hectors in the field;
    Now here he fights on Galathe his horse,
    And there lacks work; anon he's there afoot,
    And there they fly or die, like scaled sculls
    Before the belching whale; then is he yonder,
    And there the strawy Greeks, ripe for his edge,
    Fall down before him like the mower's swath.
    Here, there, and everywhere, he leaves and takes;
    Dexterity so obeying appetite
    That what he will he does, and does so much
    That proof is call'd impossibility.
  ULYSSES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O, courage, courage, courage, Princes! Great
  ULYSSES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O, courage, courage, courage, Princes! Great
    Achilles Is arming, weeping, cursing, vowing vengeance.
    Patroclus' wounds have rous'd his drowsy blood,
    Together with his mangled Myrmidons,
    That noseless, handless, hack'd and chipp'd, come to
    him, Crying on Hector. Ajax hath lost a friend
    And foams at mouth, and he is arm'd and at it,
    Roaring for Troilus; who hath done to-day
    Mad and fantastic execution,
    Engaging and redeeming of himself
    With such a careless force and forceless care
    As if that luck, in very spite of cunning,
    Bade him win all.
  AJAX. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Troilus! thou coward Troilus!                            Exit
  DIOMEDES. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Ay, there, there.
  NESTOR. 
13
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. So, so, we draw together.                              Exit
  ACHILLES.

THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Where is this Hector?
    Come, come, thou boy-queller, show thy face;
    Know what it is to meet Achilles angry.
    Hector! where's Hector? I will none but Hector.            Exeunt
  AJAX.

14
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS

DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Stand, stand, thou Greek; thou art a goodly mark.
    No? wilt thou not? I like thy armour well;
    I'll frush it and unlock the rivets all
    But I'll be master of it. Wilt thou not, beast, abide?
    Why then, fly on; I'll hunt thee for thy hide.             Exeunt
  ACHILLES. 
14
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES

DIOMEDES

AJAX

THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Come here about me, you my Myrmidons;
  ACHILLES. 
15
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PARIS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Come here about me, you my Myrmidons;
    Mark what I say. Attend me where I wheel;
    Strike not a stroke, but keep yourselves in breath;
    And when I have the bloody Hector found,
    Empale him with your weapons round about;
    In fellest manner execute your arms.
    Follow me, sirs, and my proceedings eye.
    It is decreed Hector the great must die.                   Exeunt
  THERSITES.

    now, dog! 'Loo, Paris, 'loo! now my double-horn'd Spartan! 'loo,
    Paris, 'loo! The bull has the game. Ware horns, ho!

CTOR. Most putrified core so fair without,
    Thy goodly armour thus hath cost thy life.
    Now is my day's work done; I'll take good breath:
    Rest, sword; thou hast thy fill of blood and death!
  ACHILLES.

CASSANDRA
HILLES. The dragon wing of night o'erspreads the earth
    And, stickler-like, the armies separates.
    My half-supp'd sword, that frankly would have fed,
    Pleas'd with this dainty bait, thus goes to bed.
                                                 [Sheathes his sword]
    Come, tie his body to my horse's tail;
    Along the field I will the Troyan trail.                   Exeunt
  AGAMEMNON.

NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. March patiently along. Let one be sent
    To pray Achilles see us at our tent.
    If in his death the gods have us befriended;
    Great Troy is ours, and our sharp wars are ended.
    Exeunt
  AENEAS.

  AENEAS.

MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES

  TROILUS. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. You understand me not that tell me so.
  TROILUS. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. You understand me not that tell me so.
    I do not speak of flight, of fear of death,
    But dare all imminence that gods and men
    Address their dangers in. Hector is gone.
    Who shall tell Priam so, or Hecuba?
    Let him that will a screech-owl aye be call'd
    Go in to Troy, and say there 'Hector's dead.'
    There is a word will Priam turn to stone;
    Make wells and Niobes of the maids and wives,
    Cold statues of the youth; and, in a word,
    Scare Troy out of itself. But, march away;
    Hector is dead; there is no more to say.
    Stay yet. You vile abominable tents,
    Thus proudly pight upon our Phrygian plains,
    Let Titan rise as early as he dare,
    I'll through and through you. And, thou great-siz'd coward,
    No space of earth shall sunder our two hates;
    I'll haunt thee like a wicked conscience still,
    That mouldeth goblins swift as frenzy's thoughts.
    Strike a free march to Troy. With comfort go;
    Hope of revenge shall hide our inward woe.
  PANDARUS. 
15
MARGARELON
AENEAS
AGAMEMNON
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HECTOR
AJAX
MENELAUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
THERSITES
NESTOR
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. But hear you, hear you!
  TROILUS.

  TROILUS.

    Pursue thy life and live aye with thy name!
                                              Exeunt all but PANDARUS
  PANDARUS.

NDARUS. A goodly medicine for my aching bones! world! world! thus
  PRIAM,

IAM, King of Troy
  MARGARELON,

  CALCHAS,

LCHAS, a Trojan priest, taking part with the Greeks
  PANDARUS, 
0

  AGAMEMNON, 
0

  MENELAUS, 
0

  THERSITES,

ERSITES, a deformed and scurrilous Greek
  ALEXANDER,

  SERVANT

DROMACHE, wife to Hector
  CASSANDRA, 
0
SSANDRA, daughter to Priam, a prophetess
  CRESSIDA, 
0
ESSIDA, daughter to Calchas
  TROILUS. 
0
OILUS. Call here my varlet; I'll unarm again.
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. Will this gear ne'er be mended?
  TROILUS. 
0
OILUS. The Greeks are strong, and skilful to their strength,
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. Well, I have told you enough of this; for my part,
  TROILUS. 
0
OILUS. Have I not tarried?
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. Ay, the grinding; but you must tarry the bolting.
  TROILUS. 
0
OILUS. Have I not tarried?
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. Ay, the bolting; but you must tarry the leavening.
  TROILUS. 
0
OILUS. Still have I tarried.
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. Ay, to the leavening; but here's yet in the word
  TROILUS. 
0
OILUS. Patience herself, what goddess e'er she be,
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. Well, she look'd yesternight fairer than ever I saw her
  TROILUS. 
0
OILUS. I was about to tell thee: when my heart,
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. An her hair were not somewhat darker than Helen's- well,
  TROILUS. 
0
OILUS. O Pandarus! I tell thee, Pandarus-
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. I speak no more than truth.
  TROILUS. 
0
OILUS. Thou dost not speak so much.
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. Faith, I'll not meddle in it. Let her be as she is: if
  TROILUS. 
0
OILUS. Good Pandarus! How now, Pandarus!
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. I have had my labour for my travail, ill thought on of
  TROILUS. 
0
OILUS. What, art thou angry, Pandarus? What, with me?
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. Because she's kin to me, therefore she's not so fair as
  TROILUS. 
0
OILUS. Say I she is not fair?
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. I do not care whether you do or no. She's a fool to stay
  TROILUS. 
0
OILUS. Pandarus!
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. Not I.
  TROILUS. 
0
OILUS. Sweet Pandarus!
  PANDARUS. 
0

  TROILUS. 
0

  TROILUS.

  PATROCLUS.

  SERVANT.

0

  PANDARUS. 
0

  SERVANT. 
0
RVANT. The lord be praised!
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. You know me, do you not?
  SERVANT. 
0
RVANT. Faith, sir, superficially.
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. Friend, know me better: I am the Lord Pandarus.
  SERVANT. 
0
RVANT. I hope I shall know your honour better.
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. I do desire it.
  SERVANT. 
0
RVANT. You are in the state of grace.
  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. Grace! Not so, friend; honour and lordship are my titles.
  SERVANT. 
0
RVANT. I do but partly know, sir; it is music in parts.
  PANDARUS. 
0

  SERVANT. 
0

  PANDARUS. 
0

  PANDARUS. 
0

  SERVANT. 
0

  AGAMEMNON.

PATROCLUS
AMEMNON. Your mind is the clearer, Ajax, and your virtues the
    fairer. He that is proud eats up himself. Pride is his own glass,
    his own trumpet, his own chronicle; and whatever praises itself
    but in the deed devours the deed in the praise.
  AJAX. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
AX. I do hate a proud man as I do hate the engend'ring of toads.

PATROCLUS

2

2

  SERVANT. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
RVANT. The lord be praised!

2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. You know me, do you not?
  SERVANT. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
RVANT. Faith, sir, superficially.
  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. Friend, know me better: I am the Lord Pandarus.
  SERVANT. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
RVANT. I hope I shall know your honour better.
  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. I do desire it.
  SERVANT. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
RVANT. You are in the state of grace.
  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. Grace! Not so, friend; honour and lordship are my titles.
  SERVANT. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
RVANT. I do but partly know, sir; it is music in parts.
  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. Know you the musicians?
  SERVANT. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
RVANT. Wholly, sir.

2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

2

PATROCLUS

  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. Have you seen my cousin?
  TROILUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OILUS. No, Pandarus. I stalk about her door
  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. Walk here i' th' orchard, I'll bring her straight.
  TROILUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OILUS. I am giddy; expectation whirls me round.
  TROILUS. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OILUS. I am giddy; expectation whirls me round.
    Th' imaginary relish is so sweet
    That it enchants my sense; what will it be
    When that the wat'ry palate tastes indeed
    Love's thrice-repured nectar? Death, I fear me;
    Swooning destruction; or some joy too fine,
    Too subtle-potent, tun'd too sharp in sweetness,
    For the capacity of my ruder powers.
    I fear it much; and I do fear besides
    That I shall lose distinction in my joys;
    As doth a battle, when they charge on heaps
    The enemy flying.
  PANDARUS. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. She's making her ready, she'll come straight; you must be
  TROILUS. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OILUS. Even such a passion doth embrace my bosom.
  TROILUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OILUS. Even such a passion doth embrace my bosom.
    My heart beats thicker than a feverous pulse,
    And all my powers do their bestowing lose,
    Like vassalage at unawares encount'ring
    The eye of majesty.
  PANDARUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  TROILUS.

    This brave shall oft make thee to hide thy head.
    Lady, give me your hand; and, as we walk,
    To our own selves bend we our needful talk.

AX. Thou, trumpet, there's my purse.
  ULYSSES. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
YSSES. No trumpet answers.
  ACHILLES. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
HILLES. 'Tis but early days.
  AGAMEMNON. 
4

CRESSIDA

  ULYSSES. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
YSSES. 'Tis he, I ken the manner of his gait:
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES

  DIOMEDES. 
4

CRESSIDA

  AGAMEMNON.

CRESSIDA

  NESTOR. 
4

ULYSSES

  ULYSSES. 
4

CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
YSSES. Yet is the kindness but particular;
  NESTOR. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
STOR. And very courtly counsel: I'll begin.
  ACHILLES. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
HILLES. I'll take that winter from your lips, fair lady.
  MENELAUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  PATROCLUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
TROCLUS. But that's no argument for kissing now;
  ULYSSES. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
YSSES. O deadly gall, and theme of all our scorns!
  PATROCLUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
TROCLUS. The first was Menelaus' kiss; this, mine-
  MENELAUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NELAUS. O, this is trim!
  PATROCLUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
TROCLUS. Paris and I kiss evermore for him.
  MENELAUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  CRESSIDA. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
ESSIDA. In kissing, do you render or receive?
  PATROCLUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
TROCLUS. Both take and give.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
ESSIDA. I'll make my match to live,
  MENELAUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  CRESSIDA. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
ESSIDA. You are an odd man; give even or give none.
  MENELAUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  CRESSIDA. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
ESSIDA. No, Paris is not; for you know 'tis true
  MENELAUS. 
4

ULYSSES

  CRESSIDA. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  ULYSSES. 
4

ULYSSES

  CRESSIDA. 
4

PATROCLUS

  ULYSSES.

PANDARUS

  CRESSIDA.

  ULYSSES.

  CRESSIDA. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  ULYSSES. 
4

CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  DIOMEDES.

  AGAMEMNON. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
AMEMNON. First, all you peers of Greece, go to my tent;
    There in the full convive we; afterwards,
    As Hector's leisure and your bounties shall
    Concur together, severally entreat him.
    Beat loud the tambourines, let the trumpets blow,
    That this great soldier may his welcome know.
                                   Exeunt all but TROILUS and ULYSSES
  TROILUS. 
4

  ACHILLES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HILLES. My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite
  ACHILLES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HILLES. My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite
    From my great purpose in to-morrow's battle.
    Here is a letter from Queen Hecuba,
    A token from her daughter, my fair love,
    Both taxing me and gaging me to keep
    An oath that I have sworn. I will not break it.
    Fall Greeks; fail fame; honour or go or stay;
    My major vow lies here, this I'll obey.
    Come, come, Thersites, help to trim my tent;
    This night in banqueting must all be spent.
    Away, Patroclus!                              Exit with PATROCLUS
  THERSITES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES

  AGAMEMNON.

PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ERSITES. And any man may sing her, if he can take her cliff;
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. Will you remember?
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. Remember? Yes.
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. Nay, but do, then;
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. What shall she remember?
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. List!
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. Sweet honey Greek, tempt me no more to folly.
  THERSITES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ERSITES. Roguery!
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. Nay, then-
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. I'll tell you what-
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. Fo, fo! come, tell a pin; you are a forsworn-
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. In faith, I cannot. What would you have me do?
  THERSITES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ERSITES. A juggling trick, to be secretly open.
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. What did you swear you would bestow on me?
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. I prithee, do not hold me to mine oath;
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. Good night.
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. Hold, patience!
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. How now, Troyan!
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. Diomed!
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. No, no, good night; I'll be your fool no more.
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. Thy better must.
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. Hark! a word in your ear.
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. O plague and madness!
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. You are moved, Prince; let us depart, I pray,
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. Behold, I pray you.
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. Nay, good my lord, go off;
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. I prithee stay.
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. You have not patience; come.
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. I pray you, stay; by hell and all hell's torments,
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. And so, good night.
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. Nay, but you part in anger.
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. Doth that grieve thee? O withered truth!
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. How now, my lord?
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. By Jove, I will be patient.
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. Guardian! Why, Greek!
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. Fo, fo! adieu! you palter.
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. In faith, I do not. Come hither once again.
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. You shake, my lord, at something; will you go?
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. She strokes his cheek.
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. Come, come.
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. Nay, stay; by Jove, I will not speak a word:
  THERSITES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ERSITES. How the devil luxury, with his fat rump and potato
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. But will you, then?
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. In faith, I will, lo; never trust me else.
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. Give me some token for the surety of it.
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. I'll fetch you one.                                  Exit
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. You have sworn patience.
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. Fear me not, my lord;
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Fear me not, my lord;
    I will not be myself, nor have cognition
    Of what I feel. I am all patience.
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Now the pledge; now, now, now!
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Here, Diomed, keep this sleeve.
  TROILUS. 
4

PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. O beauty! where is thy faith?
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. My lord!
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. I will be patient; outwardly I will.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. You look upon that sleeve; behold it well.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Whose was't?
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. It is no matter, now I ha't again.
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Now she sharpens. Well said, whetstone.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. I shall have it.
  CRESSIDA. 
4

PANDARUS
ACHILLES

  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS

  CRESSIDA.

  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. I had your heart before; this follows it.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS

CRESSIDA
OILUS. I did swear patience.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES

  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. I will have this. Whose was it?
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. It is no matter.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Come, tell me whose it was.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA

  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Whose was it?
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. By all Diana's waiting women yond,
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. To-morrow will I wear it on my helm,
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Wert thou the devil and wor'st it on thy horn,
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA

  DIOMEDES.

PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Why, then farewell;
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. You shall not go. One cannot speak a word
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. I do not like this fooling.
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Nor I, by Pluto; but that that likes not you
  DIOMEDES. 
4

PANDARUS

  CRESSIDA. 
4

ACHILLES
CRESSIDA

  DIOMEDES.

ACHILLES

OMEDES. Farewell till then.
  CRESSIDA.

  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES

ERSITES. A proof of strength she could not publish more,
  ULYSSES.

  TROILUS.

  ULYSSES.

  TROILUS. 
4

OILUS. To make a recordation to my soul
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. I cannot conjure, Troyan.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. She was not, sure.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. Most sure she was.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Why, my negation hath no taste of madness.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. Nor mine, my lord. Cressid was here but now.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Let it not be believ'd for womanhood.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. What hath she done, Prince, that can soil our mothers?
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Nothing at all, unless that this were she.
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Will 'a swagger himself out on's own eyes?
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. This she? No; this is Diomed's Cressida.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. May worthy Troilus be half-attach'd
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Ay, Greek; and that shall be divulged well
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. He'll tickle it for his concupy.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. O Cressid! O false Cressid! false, false, false!
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. O, contain yourself;
  AENEAS. 
4

PANDARUS

CRESSIDA
NEAS. I have been seeking you this hour, my lord.
  TROILUS. 
4

  ULYSSES.

YSSES. I'll bring you to the gates.

  CASSANDRA.

  HECTOR.

PANDARUS
ACHILLES

  CASSANDRA.

  ANDROMACHE.

DROMACHE. O, be persuaded! Do not count it holy
  CASSANDRA.

  HECTOR.

  ANDROMACHE.

  ANDROMACHE.

  HECTOR. 
4

PANDARUS

  TROILUS.

  HECTOR.

  TROILUS.

  HECTOR. 
4

  TROILUS.

  HECTOR.

  TROILUS.

OILUS. Hector, then 'tis wars.
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. Troilus, I would not have you fight to-day.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Who should withhold me?
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Who should withhold me?
    Not fate, obedience, nor the hand of Mars
    Beck'ning with fiery truncheon my retire;
    Not Priamus and Hecuba on knees,
    Their eyes o'ergalled with recourse of tears;
    Nor you, my brother, with your true sword drawn,
    Oppos'd to hinder me, should stop my way,
    But by my ruin.
  CASSANDRA. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. Lay hold upon him, Priam, hold him fast;
  PRIAM. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IAM. Come, Hector, come, go back.
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Aeneas is a-field;
  PRIAM. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IAM. Ay, but thou shalt not go.
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I must not break my faith.
  CASSANDRA.

CTOR. Andromache, I am offended with you.
    Upon the love you bear me, get you in.

  PANDARUS.

CASSANDRA

  TROILUS.

CASSANDRA

  THERSITES.

ULYSSES
PANDARUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA

                                 Exeunt TROILUS and DIOMEDES fighting
  HECTOR.

  AGAMEMNON.

PATROCLUS
AMEMNON. Your mind is the clearer, Ajax, and your virtues the
    fairer. He that is proud eats up himself. Pride is his own glass,
    his own trumpet, his own chronicle; and whatever praises itself
    but in the deed devours the deed in the praise.
  AJAX. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
RVANT. I do but partly know, sir; it is music in parts.
  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. Know you the musicians?
  SERVANT. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
RVANT. Wholly, sir.
  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. Who play they to?
  SERVANT. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
RVANT. To the hearers, sir.
  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. At whose pleasure, friend?
  SERVANT. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
RVANT. At mine, sir, and theirs that love music.
  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. Command, I mean, friend.
  SERVANT. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
RVANT. Who shall I command, sir?
  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  SERVANT. 
2

PATROCLUS

2

PATROCLUS

  HELEN.

  HELEN.

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

2

PATROCLUS

  PANDARUS.

Y. No, sir; he stays for you to conduct him thither.

  TROILUS. 
2

PATROCLUS

  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. Have you seen my cousin?
  TROILUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OILUS. No, Pandarus. I stalk about her door
  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. Walk here i' th' orchard, I'll bring her straight.
  TROILUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OILUS. I am giddy; expectation whirls me round.
  TROILUS. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OILUS. I am giddy; expectation whirls me round.
    Th' imaginary relish is so sweet
    That it enchants my sense; what will it be
    When that the wat'ry palate tastes indeed
    Love's thrice-repured nectar? Death, I fear me;
    Swooning destruction; or some joy too fine,
    Too subtle-potent, tun'd too sharp in sweetness,
    For the capacity of my ruder powers.
    I fear it much; and I do fear besides
    That I shall lose distinction in my joys;
    As doth a battle, when they charge on heaps
    The enemy flying.
  PANDARUS. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. She's making her ready, she'll come straight; you must be
  TROILUS. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OILUS. Even such a passion doth embrace my bosom.
  TROILUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OILUS. Even such a passion doth embrace my bosom.
    My heart beats thicker than a feverous pulse,
    And all my powers do their bestowing lose,
    Like vassalage at unawares encount'ring
    The eye of majesty.
  PANDARUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  TROILUS.

  THERSITES.

  PATROCLUS.

ULYSSES

  PATROCLUS. 
4

CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
TROCLUS. What you say to't?
  THERSITES. 
4

CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  PATROCLUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
TROCLUS. Your answer, sir.

ULYSSES

  ACHILLES. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  THERSITES.

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  ACHILLES.

ULYSSES

  ACHILLES.

  ACHILLES.

ULYSSES

  PANDARUS.

ULYSSES

  CRESSIDA.

  PANDARUS.

  CRESSIDA.

  CRESSIDA.

    How earnestly they knock! Pray you come in:
    I would not for half Troy have you seen here.

OILUS. Come, to the port. I'll tell thee, Diomed,
    This brave shall oft make thee to hide thy head.
    Lady, give me your hand; and, as we walk,
    To our own selves bend we our needful talk.
