CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
TROCLUS. Paris and I kiss evermore for him.
  MENELAUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NELAUS. I'll have my kiss, sir. Lady, by your leave.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
ESSIDA. In kissing, do you render or receive?
  PATROCLUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
TROCLUS. Both take and give.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
ESSIDA. I'll make my match to live,
  MENELAUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NELAUS. I'll give you boot; I'll give you three for one.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
ESSIDA. You are an odd man; give even or give none.
  MENELAUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NELAUS. An odd man, lady? Every man is odd.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
ESSIDA. No, Paris is not; for you know 'tis true
  MENELAUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NELAUS. You fillip me o' th' head.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
ESSIDA. No, I'll be sworn.
  ULYSSES. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
YSSES. It were no match, your nail against his horn.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
ESSIDA. You may.
  ULYSSES. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
YSSES. I do desire it.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
ESSIDA. Why, beg then.
  ULYSSES. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
YSSES. Why then, for Venus' sake give me a kiss
  CRESSIDA. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
ESSIDA. I am your debtor; claim it when 'tis due.
  ULYSSES. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
YSSES. Never's my day, and then a kiss of you.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OMEDES. Lady, a word. I'll bring you to your father.
  DIOMEDES. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OMEDES. Lady, a word. I'll bring you to your father.
                                                   Exit with CRESSIDA
  NESTOR. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
STOR. A woman of quick sense.
  ULYSSES. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
YSSES. Fie, fie upon her!
  ALL. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
L. The Troyans' trumpet.
  AGAMEMNON. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
AMEMNON. Yonder comes the troop.
  AENEAS. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NEAS. Hail, all the state of Greece! What shall be done
  AGAMEMNON. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
AMEMNON. Which way would Hector have it?
  AENEAS. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NEAS. He cares not; he'll obey conditions.
  ACHILLES. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
HILLES. 'Tis done like Hector; but securely done,
  AENEAS. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NEAS. If not Achilles, sir,
  ACHILLES. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
HILLES. If not Achilles, nothing.
  AENEAS. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NEAS. Therefore Achilles. But whate'er, know this:
  ACHILLES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HILLES. A maiden battle then? O, I perceive you!
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS

AMEMNON. Here is Sir Diomed. Go, gentle knight,
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
YSSES. They are oppos'd already.
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES

  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
YSSES. The youngest son of Priam, a true knight;
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS

AMEMNON. They are in action.
  NESTOR. 
4
ULYSSES

STOR. Now, Ajax, hold thine own!
  TROILUS. 
4

PANDARUS
DIOMEDES

  AGAMEMNON. 
4

  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
OMEDES. You must no more.
  AENEAS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
NEAS. Princes, enough, so please you.
  AJAX. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
AX. I am not warm yet; let us fight again.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
OMEDES. As Hector pleases.
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
CTOR. Why, then will I no more.
  AJAX. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
AX. I thank thee, Hector.
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
CTOR. Not Neoptolemus so mirable,
  AENEAS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
NEAS. There is expectance here from both the sides
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
CTOR. We'll answer it:
  AJAX. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES

  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  HECTOR.

  AJAX.

  HECTOR. 
4

PANDARUS
DIOMEDES

  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS

  AGAMEMNON. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  MENELAUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES

  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
CTOR. Who must we answer?
  AENEAS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
NEAS. The noble Menelaus.
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
CTOR. O you, my lord? By Mars his gauntlet, thanks!
  MENELAUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
NELAUS. Name her not now, sir; she's a deadly theme.
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
CTOR. O, pardon; I offend.
  NESTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS

  AENEAS. 
4

PATROCLUS
PANDARUS

NEAS. 'Tis the old Nestor.
  HECTOR.

PANDARUS

CTOR. Let me embrace thee, good old chronicle,
  NESTOR. 
4
ULYSSES

PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
STOR. I would my arms could match thee in contention
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
CTOR. I would they could.
  NESTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
STOR. Ha!
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES

  HECTOR. 
4

PANDARUS

  ULYSSES.

  HECTOR.

  ULYSSES. 
4

  ACHILLES.

  HECTOR. 
4

  ACHILLES. 
4

PANDARUS

  HECTOR. 
4

PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES

  ACHILLES.

PANDARUS

HILLES. Tell me, you heavens, in which part of his body
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES

  ACHILLES. 
4

  HECTOR. 
4

  AJAX.

  ACHILLES.

4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
CTOR. Thy hand upon that match.
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
AMEMNON. First, all you peers of Greece, go to my tent;
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
AMEMNON. First, all you peers of Greece, go to my tent;
    There in the full convive we; afterwards,
    As Hector's leisure and your bounties shall
    Concur together, severally entreat him.
    Beat loud the tambourines, let the trumpets blow,
    That this great soldier may his welcome know.
                                   Exeunt all but TROILUS and ULYSSES
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
OILUS. My Lord Ulysses, tell me, I beseech you,
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
YSSES. At Menelaus' tent, most princely Troilus.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
OILUS. Shall I, sweet lord, be bound to you so much,
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
YSSES. You shall command me, sir.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
OILUS. O, sir, to such as boasting show their scars
  ACHILLES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS

HILLES. I'll heat his blood with Greekish wine to-night,
  PATROCLUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS

TROCLUS. Here comes Thersites.
  ACHILLES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HILLES. How now, thou core of envy!
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES

  ACHILLES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HILLES. From whence, fragment?
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS

  PATROCLUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
TROCLUS. Who keeps the tent now?
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS

ERSITES. The surgeon's box or the patient's wound.
  PATROCLUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
TROCLUS. Well said, Adversity! and what needs these tricks?
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
ERSITES. Prithee, be silent, boy; I profit not by thy talk; thou
  PATROCLUS. 
4

PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
TROCLUS. Male varlet, you rogue! What's that?
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
ERSITES. Why, his masculine whore. Now, the rotten diseases of
  PATROCLUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
TROCLUS. Why, thou damnable box of envy, thou, what meanest thou
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS

ERSITES. Do I curse thee?
  PATROCLUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
TROCLUS. Why, no, you ruinous butt; you whoreson
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES

  PATROCLUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
TROCLUS. Out, gall!
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
ERSITES. Finch egg!
  ACHILLES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HILLES. My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite
  ACHILLES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HILLES. My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite
    From my great purpose in to-morrow's battle.
    Here is a letter from Queen Hecuba,
    A token from her daughter, my fair love,
    Both taxing me and gaging me to keep
    An oath that I have sworn. I will not break it.
    Fall Greeks; fail fame; honour or go or stay;
    My major vow lies here, this I'll obey.
    Come, come, Thersites, help to trim my tent;
    This night in banqueting must all be spent.
    Away, Patroclus!                              Exit with PATROCLUS
  THERSITES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
ERSITES. With too much blood and too little brain these two may
  AGAMEMNON. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
AMEMNON. We go wrong, we go wrong.
  AJAX. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
AX. No, yonder 'tis;
  HECTOR.

  DIOMEDES.

  CALCHAS.

LCHAS. [Within] Who calls?
  DIOMEDES.

  CALCHAS. 
3

PANDARUS

LCHAS. [Within] She comes to you.
  ULYSSES.

  DIOMEDES.

PANDARUS

  CRESSIDA.

ESSIDA. Now, my sweet guardian! Hark, a word with you.
  TROILUS.

ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. Yea, so familiar!
  ULYSSES. 
3

PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. She will sing any man at first sight.
  THERSITES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ERSITES. And any man may sing her, if he can take her cliff;
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. Will you remember?
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES

  DIOMEDES.

  TROILUS.

  ULYSSES. 
3

PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. List!
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. Sweet honey Greek, tempt me no more to folly.
  THERSITES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ERSITES. Roguery!
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS

  CRESSIDA. 
3

PANDARUS
ACHILLES

  DIOMEDES. 
3

PANDARUS
ACHILLES

  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. In faith, I cannot. What would you have me do?
  THERSITES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ERSITES. A juggling trick, to be secretly open.
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. What did you swear you would bestow on me?
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. I prithee, do not hold me to mine oath;
  DIOMEDES.

PANDARUS

  CRESSIDA.

PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. Diomed!
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. No, no, good night; I'll be your fool no more.
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. Thy better must.
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. Hark! a word in your ear.
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. O plague and madness!
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. You are moved, Prince; let us depart, I pray,
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. Behold, I pray you.
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. Nay, good my lord, go off;
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. I prithee stay.
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. You have not patience; come.
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. I pray you, stay; by hell and all hell's torments,
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. And so, good night.
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. Nay, but you part in anger.
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. Doth that grieve thee? O withered truth!
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. How now, my lord?
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. By Jove, I will be patient.
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. Guardian! Why, Greek!
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. Fo, fo! adieu! you palter.
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. In faith, I do not. Come hither once again.
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. You shake, my lord, at something; will you go?
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. She strokes his cheek.
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. Come, come.
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. Nay, stay; by Jove, I will not speak a word:
  THERSITES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ERSITES. How the devil luxury, with his fat rump and potato
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. But will you, then?
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. In faith, I will, lo; never trust me else.
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. Give me some token for the surety of it.
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. I'll fetch you one.                                  Exit
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. You have sworn patience.
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. Fear me not, my lord;
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Fear me not, my lord;
    I will not be myself, nor have cognition
    Of what I feel. I am all patience.
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Now the pledge; now, now, now!
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Here, Diomed, keep this sleeve.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. O beauty! where is thy faith?
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. My lord!
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. I will be patient; outwardly I will.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. You look upon that sleeve; behold it well.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Whose was't?
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. It is no matter, now I ha't again.
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Now she sharpens. Well said, whetstone.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. I shall have it.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. What, this?
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Ay, that.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. O all you gods! O pretty, pretty pledge!
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. I had your heart before; this follows it.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. I did swear patience.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. You shall not have it, Diomed; faith, you shall not;
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. I will have this. Whose was it?
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. It is no matter.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Come, tell me whose it was.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. 'Twas one's that lov'd me better than you will.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Whose was it?
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. By all Diana's waiting women yond,
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. To-morrow will I wear it on my helm,
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Wert thou the devil and wor'st it on thy horn,
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Well, well, 'tis done, 'tis past; and yet it is not;
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Why, then farewell;
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. You shall not go. One cannot speak a word
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. I do not like this fooling.
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Nor I, by Pluto; but that that likes not you
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. What, shall I come? The hour-
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Ay, come-O Jove! Do come. I shall be plagu'd.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Farewell till then.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Good night. I prithee come.                 Exit DIOMEDES
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. A proof of strength she could not publish more,
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. All's done, my lord.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. It is.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. Why stay we, then?
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. To make a recordation to my soul
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. I cannot conjure, Troyan.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. She was not, sure.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. Most sure she was.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Why, my negation hath no taste of madness.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. Nor mine, my lord. Cressid was here but now.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Let it not be believ'd for womanhood.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. What hath she done, Prince, that can soil our mothers?
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Nothing at all, unless that this were she.
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Will 'a swagger himself out on's own eyes?
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. This she? No; this is Diomed's Cressida.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. May worthy Troilus be half-attach'd
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Ay, Greek; and that shall be divulged well
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. He'll tickle it for his concupy.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. O Cressid! O false Cressid! false, false, false!
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. O, contain yourself;
  AENEAS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
NEAS. I have been seeking you this hour, my lord.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Have with you, Prince. My courteous lord, adieu.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. I'll bring you to the gates.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Accept distracted thanks.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Accept distracted thanks.
            Exeunt TROILUS, AENEAS. and ULYSSES
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Would I could meet that rogue Diomed! I would croak like
  ANDROMACHE. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
DROMACHE. When was my lord so much ungently temper'd
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. You train me to offend you; get you in.
  ANDROMACHE. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
DROMACHE. My dreams will, sure, prove ominous to the day.
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. No more, I say.
  CASSANDRA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
SSANDRA. Where is my brother Hector?
  ANDROMACHE. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
DROMACHE. Here, sister, arm'd, and bloody in intent.
  CASSANDRA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
SSANDRA. O, 'tis true!
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. Ho! bid my trumpet sound.
  CASSANDRA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
SSANDRA. No notes of sally, for the heavens, sweet brother!
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. Be gone, I say. The gods have heard me swear.
  CASSANDRA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
SSANDRA. The gods are deaf to hot and peevish vows;
  ANDROMACHE. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
DROMACHE. O, be persuaded! Do not count it holy
  CASSANDRA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
SSANDRA. It is the purpose that makes strong the vow;
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. Hold you still, I say.
  ANDROMACHE. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
DROMACHE. Cassandra, call my father to persuade.
  ANDROMACHE. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
DROMACHE. Cassandra, call my father to persuade.
                                                       Exit CASSANDRA
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. No, faith, young Troilus; doff thy harness, youth;
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Brother, you have a vice of mercy in you
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. What vice is that, good Troilus?
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. When many times the captive Grecian falls,
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. O, 'tis fair play!
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Fool's play, by heaven, Hector.
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. How now! how now!
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. For th' love of all the gods,
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. Fie, savage, fie!
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Hector, then 'tis wars.
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. Troilus, I would not have you fight to-day.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Who should withhold me?
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Who should withhold me?
    Not fate, obedience, nor the hand of Mars
    Beck'ning with fiery truncheon my retire;
    Not Priamus and Hecuba on knees,
    Their eyes o'ergalled with recourse of tears;
    Nor you, my brother, with your true sword drawn,
    Oppos'd to hinder me, should stop my way,
    But by my ruin.
  CASSANDRA. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. Lay hold upon him, Priam, hold him fast;
  PRIAM. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IAM. Come, Hector, come, go back.
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Aeneas is a-field;
  PRIAM. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IAM. Ay, but thou shalt not go.
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I must not break my faith.
  CASSANDRA. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. O Priam, yield not to him!
  ANDROMACHE. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
DROMACHE. Do not, dear father.
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Andromache, I am offended with you.
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Andromache, I am offended with you.
    Upon the love you bear me, get you in.
                                                      Exit ANDROMACHE
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. This foolish, dreaming, superstitious girl
  CASSANDRA. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. O, farewell, dear Hector!
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Away, away!
  CASSANDRA. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. Farewell!-yet, soft! Hector, I take my leave.
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. You are amaz'd, my liege, at her exclaim.
  PRIAM. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IAM. Farewell. The gods with safety stand about thee!
  PRIAM. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IAM. Farewell. The gods with safety stand about thee!
                           Exeunt severally PRIAM and HECTOR. Alarums
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. They are at it, hark! Proud Diomed, believe,
  PANDARUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Do you hear, my lord? Do you hear?
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. What now?
  PANDARUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Here's a letter come from yond poor girl.
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Let me read.
  PANDARUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. A whoreson tisick, a whoreson rascally tisick so troubles
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Words, words, mere words, no matter from the heart;
  THERSITES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Now they are clapper-clawing one another; I'll go look
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Fly not; for shouldst thou take the river Styx
  DIOMEDES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Thou dost miscall retire.
  THERSITES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Hold thy whore, Grecian; now for thy whore,
  THERSITES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Hold thy whore, Grecian; now for thy whore,
    Troyan-now the sleeve, now the sleeve!
                                 Exeunt TROILUS and DIOMEDES fighting
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. What art thou, Greek? Art thou for Hector's match?
  THERSITES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. No, no-I am a rascal; a scurvy railing knave; a very
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I do believe thee. Live.                               Exit
  THERSITES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. God-a-mercy, that thou wilt believe me; but a plague
  DIOMEDES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Go, go, my servant, take thou Troilus' horse;
  SERVANT. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RVANT. I go, my lord.                                        Exit
  AGAMEMNON. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Renew, renew! The fierce Polydamus
  NESTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Go, bear Patroclus' body to Achilles,
  ULYSSES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
YSSES. O, courage, courage, courage, Princes! Great
  AJAX. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Troilus! thou coward Troilus!                            Exit
  DIOMEDES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Ay, there, there.
  NESTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. So, so, we draw together.                              Exit
  ACHILLES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Where is this Hector?
  AJAX. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Troilus, thou coward Troilus, show thy head.
  DIOMEDES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Troilus, I say! Where's Troilus?
  AJAX. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. What wouldst thou?
  DIOMEDES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. I would correct him.
  AJAX.

  ACHILLES.

    I would have been much more a fresher man,
    Had I expected thee.

  THERSITES. 
6

TROILUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. The cuckold and the cuckold-maker are at it. Now, bull!
    now, dog! 'Loo, Paris, 'loo! now my double-horn'd Spartan! 'loo,
    Paris, 'loo! The bull has the game. Ware horns, ho!
                                            Exeunt PARIS and MENELAUS

  PANDARUS.

  TROILUS.

NEAS. How now, Prince Troilus! Wherefore not afield?

0

  AENEAS.

  TROILUS.

  AENEAS. 
0

0

  AENEAS. 
0
NEAS. Hark what good sport is out of town to-day!
  TROILUS. 
0
OILUS. Better at home, if 'would I might' were 'may.'
  AENEAS. 
0

  TROILUS. 
0

0

  CRESSIDA. 
0

  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. Well, I say Troilus is Troilus.
  CRESSIDA. 
0

  PANDARUS. 
0

  CRESSIDA. 
0

  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. Condition I had gone barefoot to India.

0

  PANDARUS. 
0
NDARUS. Himself! no, he's not himself. Would 'a were himself!

  AGAMEMNON.

PATROCLUS
AMEMNON. Your mind is the clearer, Ajax, and your virtues the
    fairer. He that is proud eats up himself. Pride is his own glass,
    his own trumpet, his own chronicle; and whatever praises itself
    but in the deed devours the deed in the praise.
  AJAX. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
RIS. Well said, my lord. Well, you say so in fits.
  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  HELEN. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  PANDARUS. 
2

PATROCLUS

  HELEN. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  PANDARUS.

2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
LEN. And to make a sweet lady sad is a sour offence.
  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  HELEN. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

PATROCLUS

2

  PARIS.

2

  PARIS. 
2

PATROCLUS

2

PATROCLUS

  HELEN. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
LEN. Why, this is kindly done.

2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  HELEN. 
2

PATROCLUS

  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. He! No, she'll none of him; they two are twain.
  HELEN. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  PANDARUS. 
2

PATROCLUS

2

PATROCLUS

2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  HELEN. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
LEN. In love, i' faith, to the very tip of the nose.
  PARIS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  PARIS. 
2

PATROCLUS

2

Y. No, sir; he stays for you to conduct him thither.
  PANDARUS.

  TROILUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS

  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. Have you seen my cousin?
  TROILUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OILUS. No, Pandarus. I stalk about her door
  PANDARUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. Walk here i' th' orchard, I'll bring her straight.
  TROILUS. 
2
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OILUS. I am giddy; expectation whirls me round.
  TROILUS. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OILUS. I am giddy; expectation whirls me round.
    Th' imaginary relish is so sweet
    That it enchants my sense; what will it be
    When that the wat'ry palate tastes indeed
    Love's thrice-repured nectar? Death, I fear me;
    Swooning destruction; or some joy too fine,
    Too subtle-potent, tun'd too sharp in sweetness,
    For the capacity of my ruder powers.
    I fear it much; and I do fear besides
    That I shall lose distinction in my joys;
    As doth a battle, when they charge on heaps
    The enemy flying.
  PANDARUS. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. She's making her ready, she'll come straight; you must be
  TROILUS. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OILUS. Even such a passion doth embrace my bosom.
  TROILUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OILUS. Even such a passion doth embrace my bosom.
    My heart beats thicker than a feverous pulse,
    And all my powers do their bestowing lose,
    Like vassalage at unawares encount'ring
    The eye of majesty.
  PANDARUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NDARUS. Come, come, what need you blush? Shame's a baby.-Here she
  TROILUS.

  CRESSIDA.

PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
HILLES. My mind is troubled, like a fountain stirr'd;
    And I myself see not the bottom of it.
                                        Exeunt ACHILLES and PATROCLUS

  PARIS.

ULYSSES

  AENEAS.

  TROILUS.

  CRESSIDA.

  PANDARUS.

  CRESSIDA.

ULYSSES

  PANDARUS.

  PANDARUS.

  CRESSIDA.

  CRESSIDA. 
4

CRESSIDA
ULYSSES

  CRESSIDA. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
ESSIDA. Come, you are deceiv'd, I think of no such thing.
    How earnestly they knock! Pray you come in:
    I would not for half Troy have you seen here.

  TROILUS.

OILUS. Come, to the port. I'll tell thee, Diomed,
    This brave shall oft make thee to hide thy head.
    Lady, give me your hand; and, as we walk,
    To our own selves bend we our needful talk.

  ULYSSES.

  MENELAUS.

  MENELAUS.

  PATROCLUS. 
4

PATROCLUS

  CRESSIDA.

CRESSIDA
ULYSSES

ESSIDA. I'll make my match to live,
  MENELAUS.

  CRESSIDA.

CRESSIDA
ULYSSES

  MENELAUS. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
NELAUS. An odd man, lady? Every man is odd.
  CRESSIDA.

CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
ESSIDA. No, Paris is not; for you know 'tis true
  MENELAUS.

  CRESSIDA.

  CRESSIDA.

  ULYSSES.

  ULYSSES.

  CRESSIDA.

PANDARUS

  ULYSSES. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
YSSES. Never's my day, and then a kiss of you.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
PANDARUS
CRESSIDA
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OMEDES. Lady, a word. I'll bring you to your father.
  DIOMEDES. 
3
PANDARUS
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
OMEDES. Lady, a word. I'll bring you to your father.
                                                   Exit with CRESSIDA
  NESTOR.

PANDARUS

STOR. A woman of quick sense.
  ULYSSES.

YSSES. Fie, fie upon her!
  ALL.

PATROCLUS
L. The Troyans' trumpet.
  AGAMEMNON.

  AGAMEMNON.

  AENEAS.

PANDARUS
ULYSSES

  ACHILLES.

ULYSSES

HILLES. 'Tis done like Hector; but securely done,
  AENEAS. 
3
PANDARUS

  ACHILLES.

  AENEAS.

  ACHILLES.

  ULYSSES.

  ULYSSES.

  AGAMEMNON.

  AENEAS.

4

  ULYSSES.

PANDARUS

  HECTOR.

  HECTOR.

  ULYSSES.

  ACHILLES.

  HECTOR.

  ACHILLES.

  AJAX.

4
ULYSSES

  AGAMEMNON. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
AMEMNON. First, all you peers of Greece, go to my tent;
  AGAMEMNON. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
AMEMNON. First, all you peers of Greece, go to my tent;
    There in the full convive we; afterwards,
    As Hector's leisure and your bounties shall
    Concur together, severally entreat him.
    Beat loud the tambourines, let the trumpets blow,
    That this great soldier may his welcome know.
                                   Exeunt all but TROILUS and ULYSSES
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES

  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES

  TROILUS. 
4

  ULYSSES.

  TROILUS. 
4

PANDARUS

  ACHILLES.

  PATROCLUS.

  THERSITES.

  ACHILLES.

  THERSITES. 
4

  PATROCLUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS

  THERSITES. 
4

  PATROCLUS.

  PATROCLUS.

  THERSITES.

  PATROCLUS.

  PATROCLUS. 
4

PATROCLUS
PANDARUS

  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES

PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
ERSITES. Finch egg!
  ACHILLES. 
4
ULYSSES
PATROCLUS
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HILLES. My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite
  ACHILLES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
HILLES. My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite
    From my great purpose in to-morrow's battle.
    Here is a letter from Queen Hecuba,
    A token from her daughter, my fair love,
    Both taxing me and gaging me to keep
    An oath that I have sworn. I will not break it.
    Fall Greeks; fail fame; honour or go or stay;
    My major vow lies here, this I'll obey.
    Come, come, Thersites, help to trim my tent;
    This night in banqueting must all be spent.
    Away, Patroclus!                              Exit with PATROCLUS
  THERSITES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
DIOMEDES
ERSITES. With too much blood and too little brain these two may
  AGAMEMNON. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS

AMEMNON. We go wrong, we go wrong.
  AJAX. 
3
ULYSSES

AX. No, yonder 'tis;
  HECTOR.

  ULYSSES.

  THERSITES.

  DIOMEDES.

  CRESSIDA.

  DIOMEDES.

  CRESSIDA. 
3

PANDARUS

  THERSITES.

PANDARUS

  CRESSIDA.

  ULYSSES.

  ULYSSES.

  TROILUS.

  ULYSSES.

  DIOMEDES.

  TROILUS.

  TROILUS. 
3

PANDARUS

  CRESSIDA.

ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. Guardian! Why, Greek!
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS

  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS

ESSIDA. In faith, I do not. Come hither once again.
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. You shake, my lord, at something; will you go?
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. She strokes his cheek.
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. Come, come.
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. Nay, stay; by Jove, I will not speak a word:
  THERSITES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ERSITES. How the devil luxury, with his fat rump and potato
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. But will you, then?
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. In faith, I will, lo; never trust me else.
  DIOMEDES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OMEDES. Give me some token for the surety of it.
  CRESSIDA. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
ESSIDA. I'll fetch you one.                                  Exit
  ULYSSES. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
YSSES. You have sworn patience.
  TROILUS. 
3
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
OILUS. Fear me not, my lord;
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Fear me not, my lord;
    I will not be myself, nor have cognition
    Of what I feel. I am all patience.
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Now the pledge; now, now, now!
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Here, Diomed, keep this sleeve.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. O beauty! where is thy faith?
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. My lord!
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. I will be patient; outwardly I will.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. You look upon that sleeve; behold it well.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Whose was't?
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. It is no matter, now I ha't again.
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Now she sharpens. Well said, whetstone.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. I shall have it.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. What, this?
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Ay, that.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. O all you gods! O pretty, pretty pledge!
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. I had your heart before; this follows it.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. I did swear patience.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. You shall not have it, Diomed; faith, you shall not;
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. I will have this. Whose was it?
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. It is no matter.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Come, tell me whose it was.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. 'Twas one's that lov'd me better than you will.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Whose was it?
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. By all Diana's waiting women yond,
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. To-morrow will I wear it on my helm,
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Wert thou the devil and wor'st it on thy horn,
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Well, well, 'tis done, 'tis past; and yet it is not;
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Why, then farewell;
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. You shall not go. One cannot speak a word
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. I do not like this fooling.
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Nor I, by Pluto; but that that likes not you
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. What, shall I come? The hour-
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Ay, come-O Jove! Do come. I shall be plagu'd.
  DIOMEDES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OMEDES. Farewell till then.
  CRESSIDA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ESSIDA. Good night. I prithee come.                 Exit DIOMEDES
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. A proof of strength she could not publish more,
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. All's done, my lord.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. It is.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. Why stay we, then?
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. To make a recordation to my soul
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. I cannot conjure, Troyan.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. She was not, sure.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. Most sure she was.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Why, my negation hath no taste of madness.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. Nor mine, my lord. Cressid was here but now.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Let it not be believ'd for womanhood.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. What hath she done, Prince, that can soil our mothers?
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Nothing at all, unless that this were she.
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Will 'a swagger himself out on's own eyes?
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. This she? No; this is Diomed's Cressida.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. May worthy Troilus be half-attach'd
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Ay, Greek; and that shall be divulged well
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. He'll tickle it for his concupy.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. O Cressid! O false Cressid! false, false, false!
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. O, contain yourself;
  AENEAS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
NEAS. I have been seeking you this hour, my lord.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Have with you, Prince. My courteous lord, adieu.
  ULYSSES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
YSSES. I'll bring you to the gates.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Accept distracted thanks.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Accept distracted thanks.
            Exeunt TROILUS, AENEAS. and ULYSSES
  THERSITES. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
ERSITES. Would I could meet that rogue Diomed! I would croak like
  ANDROMACHE. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
DROMACHE. When was my lord so much ungently temper'd
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. You train me to offend you; get you in.
  ANDROMACHE. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
DROMACHE. My dreams will, sure, prove ominous to the day.
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. No more, I say.
  CASSANDRA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
SSANDRA. Where is my brother Hector?
  ANDROMACHE. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
DROMACHE. Here, sister, arm'd, and bloody in intent.
  CASSANDRA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
SSANDRA. O, 'tis true!
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. Ho! bid my trumpet sound.
  CASSANDRA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
SSANDRA. No notes of sally, for the heavens, sweet brother!
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. Be gone, I say. The gods have heard me swear.
  CASSANDRA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
SSANDRA. The gods are deaf to hot and peevish vows;
  ANDROMACHE. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
DROMACHE. O, be persuaded! Do not count it holy
  CASSANDRA. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
SSANDRA. It is the purpose that makes strong the vow;
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. Hold you still, I say.
  ANDROMACHE. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
DROMACHE. Cassandra, call my father to persuade.
  ANDROMACHE. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
DROMACHE. Cassandra, call my father to persuade.
                                                       Exit CASSANDRA
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. No, faith, young Troilus; doff thy harness, youth;
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Brother, you have a vice of mercy in you
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. What vice is that, good Troilus?
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. When many times the captive Grecian falls,
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. O, 'tis fair play!
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Fool's play, by heaven, Hector.
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. How now! how now!
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. For th' love of all the gods,
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. Fie, savage, fie!
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Hector, then 'tis wars.
  HECTOR. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CTOR. Troilus, I would not have you fight to-day.
  TROILUS. 
4
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
OILUS. Who should withhold me?
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Who should withhold me?
    Not fate, obedience, nor the hand of Mars
    Beck'ning with fiery truncheon my retire;
    Not Priamus and Hecuba on knees,
    Their eyes o'ergalled with recourse of tears;
    Nor you, my brother, with your true sword drawn,
    Oppos'd to hinder me, should stop my way,
    But by my ruin.
  CASSANDRA. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. Lay hold upon him, Priam, hold him fast;
  PRIAM. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IAM. Come, Hector, come, go back.
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Aeneas is a-field;
  PRIAM. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IAM. Ay, but thou shalt not go.
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I must not break my faith.
  CASSANDRA. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. O Priam, yield not to him!
  ANDROMACHE. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
DROMACHE. Do not, dear father.
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Andromache, I am offended with you.
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Andromache, I am offended with you.
    Upon the love you bear me, get you in.
                                                      Exit ANDROMACHE
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. This foolish, dreaming, superstitious girl
  CASSANDRA.

SSANDRA. O, farewell, dear Hector!
  TROILUS. 
5

PANDARUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Away, away!
  CASSANDRA. 
5
ULYSSES

ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
SSANDRA. Farewell!-yet, soft! Hector, I take my leave.
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. You are amaz'd, my liege, at her exclaim.
  PRIAM.

ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
IAM. Farewell. The gods with safety stand about thee!
  PRIAM.

IAM. Farewell. The gods with safety stand about thee!

  TROILUS.

PANDARUS

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. They are at it, hark! Proud Diomed, believe,
  PANDARUS.

NDARUS. Do you hear, my lord? Do you hear?
  TROILUS.

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. What now?
  PANDARUS. 
5
ULYSSES

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. Here's a letter come from yond poor girl.
  TROILUS.

ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Let me read.
  PANDARUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. A whoreson tisick, a whoreson rascally tisick so troubles
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Words, words, mere words, no matter from the heart;
  THERSITES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Now they are clapper-clawing one another; I'll go look
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Fly not; for shouldst thou take the river Styx
  DIOMEDES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Thou dost miscall retire.
  THERSITES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Hold thy whore, Grecian; now for thy whore,
  THERSITES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. Hold thy whore, Grecian; now for thy whore,
    Troyan-now the sleeve, now the sleeve!
                                 Exeunt TROILUS and DIOMEDES fighting
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. What art thou, Greek? Art thou for Hector's match?
  THERSITES. 
5
ULYSSES

ACHILLES
CRESSIDA

  HECTOR. 
5

CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I do believe thee. Live.                               Exit
  THERSITES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS

  DIOMEDES.

  SERVANT.

RVANT. I go, my lord.                                        Exit

  AJAX.

  ACHILLES.

  DIOMEDES.

  AJAX.

ACHILLES

CASSANDRA
AX. What wouldst thou?
  DIOMEDES. 
5

  AJAX. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. Were I the general, thou shouldst have my office
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES

CASSANDRA

  DIOMEDES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. Ha! art thou there?
  AJAX. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. I'll fight with him alone. Stand, Diomed.
  DIOMEDES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. He is my prize. I will not look upon.
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Come, both, you cogging Greeks; have at you
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Yea, Troilus? O, well fought, my youngest brother!
  ACHILLES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Now do I see thee, ha! Have at thee, Hector!
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Pause, if thou wilt.
  ACHILLES. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. I do disdain thy courtesy, proud Troyan.
  HECTOR. 
5
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Fare thee well.
  HECTOR. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Fare thee well.
    I would have been much more a fresher man,
    Had I expected thee.
  TROILUS. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Ajax hath ta'en Aeneas. Shall it be?
  HECTOR. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Stand, stand, thou Greek; thou art a goodly mark.
  ACHILLES. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Come here about me, you my Myrmidons;
  THERSITES. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. The cuckold and the cuckold-maker are at it. Now, bull!
  THERSITES. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. The cuckold and the cuckold-maker are at it. Now, bull!
    now, dog! 'Loo, Paris, 'loo! now my double-horn'd Spartan! 'loo,
    Paris, 'loo! The bull has the game. Ware horns, ho!
                                            Exeunt PARIS and MENELAUS
  MARGARELON. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RGARELON. Turn, slave, and fight.
  THERSITES. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. What art thou?
  MARGARELON. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RGARELON. A bastard son of Priam's.
  THERSITES. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
ERSITES. I am a bastard too; I love bastards. I am a bastard
  MARGARELON. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RGARELON. The devil take thee, coward!                       Exit
  HECTOR. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. Most putrified core so fair without,
  ACHILLES. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Look, Hector, how the sun begins to set;
  HECTOR. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
CTOR. I am unarm'd; forego this vantage, Greek.
  ACHILLES. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. Strike, fellows, strike; this is the man I seek.
  MYRMIDON. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
RMIDON. The Troyan trumpets sound the like, my lord.
  ACHILLES. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
HILLES. The dragon wing of night o'erspreads the earth
  AGAMEMNON. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. Hark! hark! what shout is this?
  NESTOR. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
STOR. Peace, drums!
  SOLDIERS. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
LDIERS. [Within] Achilles! Achilles! Hector's slain. Achilles!
  DIOMEDES. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OMEDES. The bruit is Hector's slain, and by Achilles.
  AJAX. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AX. If it be so, yet bragless let it be;
  AGAMEMNON. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
AMEMNON. March patiently along. Let one be sent
  AENEAS. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. Stand, ho! yet are we masters of the field.
  TROILUS. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hector is slain.
  ALL. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
L. Hector! The gods forbid!
  TROILUS. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. He's dead, and at the murderer's horse's tail,
  AENEAS. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NEAS. My lord, you do discomfort all the host.
  TROILUS. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. You understand me not that tell me so.
  PANDARUS. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. But hear you, hear you!
  TROILUS. 
6
ULYSSES
PANDARUS
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hence, broker-lackey. Ignominy and shame
  TROILUS. 
5
ULYSSES
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
OILUS. Hence, broker-lackey. Ignominy and shame
    Pursue thy life and live aye with thy name!
                                              Exeunt all but PANDARUS
  PANDARUS. 
5
ULYSSES
TROILUS
ACHILLES
CRESSIDA
CASSANDRA
NDARUS. A goodly medicine for my aching bones! world! world! thus
